projects.title: A Novel Method for Fake News Classification
projects.description: In this study after exhaustive study of current methods for fake news detection, we came up with ensemble model consisting two classifiers. First was a model with an information retrieval module and a feed-forward neural network to integrate the knowledge-base for fake news detection. The second was style based classification model utilizing word embeddings and Bi-LSTM.

projects.title: Understanding Crowd Behavior using Unsupervised Deep Neural Networks
projects.description: •For this project we deployed two individual models for simulating crowd movement behavior in public places, such as subway stations, in a team of four.•The proposed approaches include non-linear PCA based networks belonging to the autoencoders family more specifically Variational Autoencoders, as well as deep generative models trained under an adversarial setting more specifically WGAN.•I was solely responsible for representation and feature extraction, where I created a novel representation which used probabilistic heat map generated with overlapping Gaussian kernels.

projects.title: Traffic Analysis from CCTV Footage (for CAIT)
projects.description: •I worked on this project with Dr. Xiang Liu as part of my job at Center for Advance Infrastructure and Transportation (CAIT).•For this project I developed a computer vision program to analyze the traffic from CCTV footage for Center for Advanced Infrastructure and Transportation.•The program would take a video file consisting CCTV footage at a railway crossing and computed count, relative speed, direction and time of crossing for both pedestrians and vehicles.•The program achieved accuracy of 94% and computation time 60% less than actual video time, making it suitable for real time application. * The project was oriented on creating computationally light weight video processing solution which can potentially be used on light weight systems (like raspberry pi) in real time.•The program used background subtraction and Kalman filter for tracking and counting.

experience.title: Software Engineer
experience.description: • Engineered an NPM library to provide message reprocessing that smoothly integrates with the KafkaJS library by wrapping the consumer and producers into a single service with configurable retry options.• Used Typescript to provide access to the Node.js/NPM environment while having statically typed analysis at compile-time for better development debugging and strong intelli-sense capabilities in development.• Designed Node.js/Express servicer to efficiently handle API requests and to serve client side files as well provide event-driven mechanism to handle the asynchronous functions of KakfaJS in a non-blocking manner.• Built a WebSockets server on top of nodejs-websocket to provide real time communication within the demo server to provide the front-end client with updates on the Kafka-Cascade state using an express middleware API. • Utilized React to create a modular front-end that would provide a UI for visualizing the Kakfa-Cascade library.• Created a Jest framework to provide flexible testing of the library by mocking the KafkaJS API and enabling continuous integration with automatic testing through Github Actions.• Built the application using Webpack to enable a better development environment to transpile TSX and Typescript into a single optimized bundle without the need to use the Typescript compiler explicitly as a middle step.

publications.title: Development Of Sustainable Monitoring Methods For At-Grade Railroad Transit Clear Zones
publications.subtitle: Rutgers-CAIT
publications.description: The purpose of the research was to develop a cost-effective maintenance program to aid public and private agencies in the prevention of vehicle-train collisions at crossings. Building on previous investigations, Rutgers CAIT proposed to navigate a tethered, helium filled vinyl non-rigid airship (Blimp) with a mounted camera pan/tilt assembly. The equipment is remotely operated from the ground through a control device that displays images from the camera attached to the blimp. Levers allow the user to adjust pitch and roll as well as zoom and capture of still images.Testing was performed in May 2011, at two separate highway-rail crossings, including Industrial Avenue, South Brunswick, New Jersey; and Raritan Center Parkway, Edison, New Jersey. Images collected were analyzed and mapped using AutoCAD 2012, student version. Missing background imaging, resulting from gaps between images and ancillary to the study, at an acceptable distance from the crossing, was cropped in from readily available internet based mapping. An appropriate scale was determined by comparing the actual street width and subsequent measurement of the photographed street using the software. Based on the appropriate scale, sight triangles were calculated, drawn and superimposed onto the “stitched” imaging. Excess vegetation and other obstructions were identified and cataloged.The technology provides a low-cost, simple mechanism to image, identify and catalog needed maintenance at highway-rail crossings. Due to the dense network of overhead utility infrastructure as well as heavily traveled highways, the technology is limited in its application within the state of New Jersey. However, other states may have a higher frequency of crossings with no overhead obstructions. These states should be identified and presented with the opportunity to apply this low-cost method for monitoring and maintaining these crossings.

publications.title: Automated Antitheft and Accident Detection System for the Elderly
publications.subtitle: International journal of Applied Engineering Research
publications.description: An automated home control system is a complex system that includes a careful and astute integration of three particular domains i.e security, luxury and environment adaptability. The need for such an intelligent system to monitor our homes arises out of growing concerns about felonies, security threats as well as our desire to make our lives more comfortable. Also in the present scenario, many older couples are forced to live on their own in houses that fall very short on optimum security measures and emergency services due to various socio-economic reasons. Generally older people are seen as soft targets by callous offenders. Another grave problem faced by the senior citizens is their inability to get timely help in case of physical injuries while at home as they are debilitating to a great effect. This again puts them under harm's way. Hence we have come up with a unique system called ProGuard that not only takes care of these aforementioned security issue, but also provides enough luxury and adaptability to the milieu to make the lives of people using it secure and comfortable. The simulation software used by us is proteus.

projects.title: Next word prediction using deep neural networks
projects.description: Devised a model to predict the next word based on the current user input using the n-gram model, Long short term memory (LSTM) neural network and Gated recurrent unit (GRU) neural network. Used the theano library along with python to build, train and test the three models.Compared the performances of the three model in the field of language modeling. Used the reddit comments and the US_blogs dataset to train the three models and the results of the models were judged based on the prediction quality.

projects.title: Trajectory Planning using A* algorithm
projects.description: • Project in Java• Created a grid world environment which generates mazes of size 101 x 101.• Implemented A* algorithm to find the shortest path between two cells in the randomly generated grid.•Implemented Repeated Forward, Backward and Adaptive A* search algorithms to find a path between two cells in the generated grid.

projects.title: Dynamic Topic Modelling using Latent Dirichlet Allocation on Reuters Dataset
projects.description: Devised a model to apply dynamic topic modelling on Reuters Dataset. We first scraped the Reuters archive website to get articles from 2007-2015 using Amazon services like Simple Queue service(SQS), Amazon EC2 instances and S3 bucket storage. We applied the stochastic collapsed variational inference (SCVB0) algorithm on the dataset to output a set of topics and the top 10 words in that topic. We propogated parameters from one time slice to another to maintain topic distributions to study topic evolution.We also analyzed the results by studying the evolution of a particular topic over a period from 2007 - 2015. Perplexity parameter was used to judge the performance of the model.

projects.title: StockUsNow
projects.description: Created a webpage using Java, JavaScript and MySQL to store live and historical stock price data. Used the Bayesian Curve fitting technique for short term stock prediction to predict the stock price for the next 10 days. Used the Support Vector Machines (SVM) and Artificial Neural Networks (ANN) for long term prediction of the stock price. SVM was implemented using the libsvm library and ANN was implemented using the neuroph library in Java. Used SVM and ANN to predict the stock prices for the next 40 and 5 days respectively.

projects.title: GitHub Visualisation and Recommendation
projects.description: A recommendation system based on the archived GitHub dataset from 2011-2014. It recommends potential repositories for a given username which he can contribute to. Likewise it also recommends a list of potential contributors who can contribute on a given repository.

projects.title: Image Classification
projects.description: • Project in Java• Implemented Perceptron, Naïve Bayesian and MIRA classifiers and applied it on digit and face classification datasets.•Successfully obtained accuracy of 85% on the digit classification dataset and 84% on the face classification dataset.

projects.title: Rough Clustering of Sequential Data
projects.description: This is a Data Science project wherein a combination of fuzzy logic and rough set theory is applied on sequential dataset of the web page visits by the users and form rough clusters of users based on their page visit preferences. The clusters of users thus formed,can be used to study / predict a particular users web presence and preferences efficiently

projects.title: Green House Emission Control System (GEMS)
projects.description: This project got its input from various sensors installed on the chemical factory emission outlets. These inputs were then stored in a MySQL database. Certain calculations of main emission rates were calculated based on the sensor values. These emission rates were compared to allowed emission rates and the user was alerted if the emission rates crossed the set limits. The project was developed in PHP and MySQL.

projects.description: HackRU Fall 2015 Hack. The idea was to create a free way for users to contribute monetarily to charities by visiting and viewing and participating in their online campaigns. Each Non-Profit would also have its own page on the website with ads displayed to users. All ad revenue from this would go to charities.Built backend with Django for Python, used SQLite to store information about users and charities. Built front-end with bootstrap and presented a GUI that showed ads and charity pages.

projects.title: 3D Hologram Tetris
projects.description: Best Hardware Hack - HackRU Spring 2015. Used an Acrylic pyramid, Unity, Arduino and Buttons to create a 3D Physical hologram of the game of Tetris. When a screen with the Unity scene projected onto the acrylic pyramid, players can play a 3D Rendition of tetris using the buttons connected by the arduino.

organizations.title: National Convention of Gospel Choirs & Choruses, Inc.
organizations.membership_type: National YYA Officer, Sargent in Arms
organizations.description: The National Convention of Gospel Choirs and Choruses is the oldest gospel music convention in the world. Founded by Dr. Thomas A Dorsey in 1932, the mission of the NCGCC is to foster and better the appreciation of Gospel music. NCGCC fulfills its mission through performances, training, education and related activities. Every year there is a week long convention during the first week of August where members from all over the country gather. The mission of NCGCC is to educate the church community, gospel music industry, the listeners, community, colleges, universities, composers, arrangers, producers and performers, directors, musicians, singers and others who perform gospel music to manifest and demonstrate the essence of sound business and performance with the high standards of excellence in keeping with the long tradition of the gospel music founders; To restate the vast difference between songs that are divinely inspired and the modern non-secular music of the twenty-first century; To expand the horizons of gospel music into other culturally diverse environments; To foster and promote interdenominational fellowship amid its entities, i.e. choral unions, chapters, departments, and national regions.

organizations.title: Collegiate 100
organizations.description: The Collegiate 100, a programmatic arm of 100 Black Men of America, Inc. – particularly the 100 Black Men of New Jersey, is a prestigious organization of dedicated students. These students are committed to volunteerism and improving the community through mentoring and being positive role models for African-American youth. This organization also empowers the black community through the Four for the Future plan of mentoring, education, health and wellness, and economic development. The goal is to mentor and build up the scholars so that they too can mentor and build up the next generation of scholars. These dedicated individuals must present themselves in good academic standing, go through a rigorous application process, and be committed to community service, mentoring, and a positive record of involvement and engagement on and off campus.

projects.title: Personal Website Development
projects.description: Developed a personal page that contains summary, resume and description of projects.• Used HTML to build the content of website and used CSS for style design on the website.• Implemented Bootstrap framework for well-organized layout and images handling.• Used jQuery Library of JavaScript to implement dynamic slider and other dynamic components on the website.

projects.title: School Parking Map Android App
projects.description: Objective: Design a parking map application based on android that indicates appropriate parking lot to all different parking permits.• Built server on EC2 with Ubuntu operating system to store parking lot information and answer the request of reporting event parking and tickets from client through JSON format.• Google Maps API and Google Places API are integrated in application that supply visual map and search places functions.

projects.title: Web application of Stock Price Forecaster
projects.description: Developed a website that can supply registered users information of stocks and suggestion on operation of deal.•Used YQL to cite stock information directly from Yahoo Finance and store them into MySQL database. •Used HTML to develop a website with framework layout. By using PHP-MySQL functions, users can create profile, view real time and historical price of stocks; add their favorite stocks into personal page in order to check them quickly. •Wrote Curve fitting class in Java to make prediction on price and help user determine operation on their stock, which connected to web by PHP/Java Bridge, an XML-based network protocol.

projects.title: Mobile Game Design
projects.description: Developed a mobile ball-match-three games to be installed both Android and IOS. •Used cocos2d-x (an open source game framework written in C++) to establish the physical word that has gravity upon all balls to help them fall naturally; to add flashing effect on special function balls for more entertainment experience.•Used C++ to supply all other support such as collection, delete and color matching.•Used Cygwin to transplant game into APK in order to be implemented on Android system.

projects.title: Pokemon TCG Card and Game State Recognition
projects.description: As part of a collaborative team, I developed a computer vision system to enhance gameplay understanding and experience in the Pokémon Trading Card Game. Our project focused on identifying and visualizing key card parameters such as hit points (HP), moves, and status effects through advanced image processing techniques.Key contributions included:Data Collection & Labeling: Built a comprehensive dataset of thousands of Pokémon cards to facilitate model training.Model Development: Utilized deep learning frameworks, including TensorFlow and OpenCV, to create robust models for card detection and classification.Object Detection: Implemented state-of-the-art convolutional neural networks to accurately recognize card types and extract vital information.Performance Optimization: Evaluated model effectiveness using precision, recall, and F1 score metrics, achieving real-time recognition capabilities.This project not only improved game analysis for players but also provided valuable insights for spectators, showcasing the intersection of technology and gaming.

projects.title: User File System using FUSE
projects.description: Made a simple user file system implementing the FUSE library. This project allows users to create files, and directories within a command line environment, by mounting a created drive with our code. Additionally, users can read,write, or change permissions within the command shell, as well as move file and directories.

projects.title: Movie Database Sorting
projects.description: This is an in-class project for Systems Programming. This is a multi-stage project that deals with sorting a large CSV file of movie information. The sort performed is based on different user inputs and go to a specified directory to find all CSV files that fit our format sorts them and outputs them to their respective directories. Additionally, we implemented forking and child processes; however, both Harsh and I are exploring multi-threading implementations to increase performance and over all organization. More information including the code is on the GitHub link.

projects.title: Web Based Stock Forecaster (6 people)
projects.description: Designed and lead a back-end team of three people that created a stock prediction website. This website's purpose was to help average people get involved in the stock market. My role dealt with overseeing the distribution of work. I Managed communication between members of the back end sub-team. Additionally, I was responsible for checking merge requests, as well as communicating with the Front End leader to make sure both parts of the project share a common API. Besides managing work flow, I created python code to fetch and organize stock information for database use. I also Created mathematical models and prediction algorithms for stock prediction, which implemented Momentum-based and Least Square Approximation algorithms to predict stock prices.

projects.title: MS Globe
projects.description: Using Google's WebGL Globe API and Matlab, I programmed a script file that pre-processed CSV files into JSON files. Then using javascript and google's API, I plotted information regarding the diagnosis of Ms onto a 3D globe. I did this to increase the awareness around Multiple Sclerosis. Finally, I have uploaded the site to www.msglobe.org so that it is easily accessible to the public.

projects.title: Medical Database
projects.description: Worked to develop a MongoDB database to organize hospital patients in an attempt to expedite care to more critically injured individuals. I specifically programmed a client-side javascript/HTML 5 based web page for communication with the database. Additionally, I assisted with the implementation of a Pebble-Smart watch application.

projects.title: Arduino Bluetooth Multi-Colored LED Lights
projects.description: I Programmed an Arduino Uno to control a Bluetooth controlled array of RGB lights. Also I designed a simple Guided User Interface for color selection and pattern on user's phone.

projects.title: Tapp App
projects.description: I Developed an Android program to control various phone commands without the user's phone leaving their pocket. It worked with Android 4.2 to 4.4 and my portion of the development was programming a media player that worked off of tap gestures based on input from the accelerometer to play, pause, skip, and reverse songs. Additionally, I tested and graphed values in order to account for regular movement, so it was not mistaken as input. Presented the app live in front of an audience at Hack RU 2013.

honors_and_awards.description: The National Honor Society (NHS) is the nation's premier organization established to recognize outstanding high school students. publications.title: Fairness across Network Positions in Cyberbullying Detection Algorithms
publications.subtitle: Rutgers Behavioral Informatics Lab
publications.description: Cyberbullying, which often has a deeply negative impact on the victim, has grown as a serious issue in Online Social Networks. Recently, researchers have created automated machine learning algorithms to detect Cyberbullying using social and textual features. However, the very algorithms that are intended to fight off one threat (cyberbullying) may inadvertently be falling prey to another important threat (bias of the automatic detection algorithms). This is exacerbated by the fact that while the current literature on algorithmic fairness has multiple empirical results, metrics, and algorithms for countering bias across immediately observable demographic characteristics (e.g. age, race, gender), there have been no efforts at empirically quantifying the variation in algorithmic performance based on the network role or position of individuals. We audit an existing cyberbullying algorithm using Twitter data for disparity in detection performance based on the network centrality of the potential victim and then demonstrate how this disparity can be countered using an Equalized Odds post-processing technique. The results pave way for more accurate and fair cyberbullying detection algorithms.

experience.description: I designed a full-stack tool to read IT ticket data from excel spreadsheets and discover patterns. I also developed a comprehensive settings menu that allows users to tweak model parameters and created data visualizations to illustrate ticket patterns and display predictions. The tool is implemented with AngularJS (Javascript/Typescript + HTML + CSS) and Python (Anaconda + Flask/RESTful Service).

In the summers of 2010 and 2011, I volunteered as a primary school teacher in Gaomang Primary School in Guizhou Province, China. The school was the only cemented building in a needy village which was hidden in mountains in the southern China. The children there wished to learn but teachers and books were very rare resources. That's why I went there in the first year and went back in the second. I also contacted more than 20 sponsors in the city who were willing to support the children's study…

          In the summers of 2010 and 2011, I volunteered as a primary school teacher in Gaomang Primary School in Guizhou Province, China. The school was the only cemented building in a needy village which was hidden in mountains in the southern China. The children there wished to learn but teachers and books were very rare resources. That's why I went there in the first year and went back in the second. I also contacted more than 20 sponsors in the city who were willing to support the children's study until high school. Now the village is much better than 5 years ago, but I still miss there.

patents.title: Adaptive rate control based on overload signals
patents.description: Described are methods and apparatuses, including computer program products, for limiting server overload via client control. A first set of a plurality of requests are transmitted to a server at a first transmission rate during a first period of time. The first transmission rate is limited to be less than or equal to a first transmission limit rate. An overload value is determined based on whether at least two or more requests of the first set of requests for service satisfy an overload criterion. A second transmission limit rate is determined based on the overload value and the first transmission limit rate. A second set of a plurality of requests is transmitted to the server at a second transmission rate during a second period of time. The second transmission rate is limited to be less than or equal to the second transmission limit rate.

recommendations: Isaac (.ike) Levy “Dat's no-nonsense business operational analysis was an incredible gift for the Ops team, and the entire Sailthru organization, as he worked hands-on with every aspect of a large datacenter move. Dat's cost analysis work has immediately helped us translate business strategy into tactical engineering decision making- with amazing outcomes. From an analysis of cloud to colocaion, Dat helped us re-structure the way we think and communicate our strategic operational web infrastructure costs, while providing frameworks and tools to manage and project costs moving forward- touching nearly every group in the business. To immerse himself in the Ops process, Dat picked up and dove into classic sysadmin work- hands on helping deploy new clusters of UNIX systems in colocation and cloud environments, building and securing physical networks from scratch, and moving complicated applications between various POP's. Along with the new builds, Dat worked with us moving legacy hardware, software, stitching together legacy networks, and automating various tasks with scripts. Dat transcended his internship for his Ops work, picking up and becoming a valuable sysadmin contributor to every aspect of this massive team undertaking, and can certainly handle himself in a datacenter. If he weren't a business analyst, Dat could become a heck of a UNIX sysadmin. As a business analyst, Dat's calm no nonsense approach is a force to be reckoned with- I look forward to seeing where Dat aims his talents through his career!”

projects.description: Created a street number detection and recognition system to identify and label any sequence of digits visible in a supplied image. Used tensorflow to create the machine learning model for classification, and used computer vision techniques such as an image pyramid, sliding window, and non-maximum suppression for digit detection/localization.

projects.title: OpenAI Gym – Lunar Lander
projects.description: Trained an agent to complete the lunar lander task within the OpenAI gym environment using reinforcement learning techniques such as Q-learning and Deep Q Networks (DQN).

projects.title: Udacity Machine Learning Capstone - State Farm Distracted Driver Detection
projects.description: Capstone project utilized deep learning to perform image classification for a Kaggle Competition. Created a Convolutional Neural Network in Python using Keras/Tensorflow to detect if drivers are distracted at the wheel. CNN was trained on colored images of drivers performing a variety of actions such as texting, calling, talking, driving safely, etc. The trained model can classify a driver's actions into one of 10 categories which include:c0: safe drivingc1: texting - rightc2: talking on the phone - rightc3: texting - leftc4: talking on the phone - leftc5: operating the radioc6: drinkingc7: reaching behindc8: hair and makeupc9: talking to passengerhttps://www.kaggle.com/c/state-farm-distracted-driver-detection

patents.title: Retractable Gripping Apparatus for Walking Assistance Devices
patents.description: •Inventor & Owner of United States Patent Application 20130092201•Creator of all designs & responsible for communicating ideas and coordinating efforts with patent lawyer and engineersA safety device provides a retractable gripping device for use in conjunction with walking assistance devices such that a user may safely navigate on slippery surfaces. An activating mechanism is provided for user convenience. A locking mechanism moves into a locked position. To deactivate the gripping device, the user again activates a deactivating device to return the gripping device back to its retracted, deactivated position. The gripping device is configured such that it may be used in conjunction with existing walking assistance devices. The retractable gripping mechanism and locking device are preferably controlled by the user with minimal effort, with the control mechanism positioned at or near where the users hands are positioned during use.

name: Zaina Merchant
position: Environmental Engineering Student at Rutgers University | James J. Slade Scholar
about:
Hello! My name is Zaina and I am a senior at Rutgers University pursuing a bachelor’s degree in environmental engineering.

During my undergraduate career, I have conducted air quality research for 2 years, specifically investigating the disproportionate impacts of air pollution on environmental justice communities.

Through my experiential and educational learning, I have become passionate about environmental justice, and the development of equitable public policies to address environmental hazards faced by underserved and vulnerable communities. I am also an advocate for open science, the accessibility of scientific knowledge to the general public, and science that serves society.

I am proficient in Python, MATLAB, Excel, AutoCAD, and SketchUp. I have also participated in various mentorship and teaching endeavors, allowing me to enhance interpersonal skills such as communication, public speaking, teamwork, adaptability, and leadership.

I am always looking for opportunities to apply my skills and grow not only as a student but as a Steward of the Earth. Please feel free to connect with me and reach out!

volunteer_experience.info:
As the lead organizer of TEDxYouth@LakeManalapan, I had the privilege of spearheading the organization of an event that brought together a diverse range of speakers and attendees. My primary responsibility was to create a platform that would showcase local voices, while also procuring the necessary funding to bring the event to fruition.To ensure that the event would resonate with a younger audience, I spent a considerable amount of time tailoring the talks to introduce diverse skill…
            

    
    

    
        Show more

          
    
  
      

        
          As the lead organizer of TEDxYouth@LakeManalapan, I had the privilege of spearheading the organization of an event that brought together a diverse range of speakers and attendees. My primary responsibility was to create a platform that would showcase local voices, while also procuring the necessary funding to bring the event to fruition.To ensure that the event would resonate with a younger audience, I spent a considerable amount of time tailoring the talks to introduce diverse skill sets and perspectives. I wanted our attendees to be exposed to a broad range of ideas and concepts that were relevant to their lives and experiences.When the day of the event finally arrived, it was heartening to see the turnout. Over 2,000 people attended the event, and the energy in the room was palpable. Our speakers delivered thought-provoking talks that covered a range of topics, from environmental conservation to mental health, and their insights resonated with the audience.Following the event, I was thrilled to see that the talks had gained traction online. With over 1,000,000 views since the event, it was clear that the ideas shared at TEDxYouth@LakeManalapan had struck a chord with people far beyond our local community.Overall, the experience of organizing TEDxYouth@LakeManalapan was incredibly rewarding. It was a privilege to work with such a talented and passionate team of individuals, and I'm proud of the impact that our event has had on both our local community and the wider world.
            

    
    

    
        Show less

projects.title: High Speed Augmented Reality Application Over TCP/IP Networks
projects.description: •Developed an Augmented Reality application to provide real-time information as holographic projections using Microsoft HoloLens. • Designed a GUI that dynamically changes color based on direction and plays a sound based on weather trigger (eg. rain, snow, windy, etc.) •Established a TCP socket with System Sockets for the Microsoft HoloLens, which is one of the first attempts to use a socket on the device. The socket was then connected to a Linux-based cloud server using a C# server. • Used a dynamic mySQL database, which updates real-time information. •Aiming to establish Mobility First Network on this socket and improve communication speed throughout the world to a few milliseconds

projects.title: Stock Predictor using Machine Learning
projects.description: Developed a web application to predict the value of stock and give user recommendation to buy/sell stock using SVM, LSTM, and Bayesian. The user would be able to login, create account, favorite stocks, and get live news feed for each stock.

projects.title: Local Chat Room
projects.description: Developed a Local Chatroom application for Android devices with Android Studio The server was set up on a PC using NetBeans IDE. The communication was done using TCP Sockets.

projects.title: Application in Augmented Reality for Use with Microsoft Hololens
projects.description: The project combines Microsoft Hololens with IoT to give you real-time information about smart devices in a building.The Hololens wearer can look at printers, routers to get real-time info such the print queues, network traffic, the number of devices connected to the router, room occupancy etc.The application also includes navigation features that enable the wearer to find his way inside the building.

projects.title: Virtual Reality Game- Move and Shoot
projects.description: Used Razer Hydra to control, move, and perform precision shooting on targets placed randomly on a screen.

projects.title: Navigation With Unity
projects.description: oWorked on a Navigator project with Unity. Designed a path finder to reach different locations with NavMesh Agent and NavMesh Obstacles. oThe agents were click-to-move objects, which would find the shortest-weighted paths from one point to another based on click. oThe agents had to avoid higher-weighted paths and the obstacles that were on the way. The obstacles were both static and dynamic. oThis path finder had different agents and one such agent was the Nazgul agent which had both the Agent and Obstacle components of the NavMesh.

positions.subtitle: Verizon
positions.description: Mentor a cross functional analytics team of data scientists in the Verizon B2B space. Project lead for data mining initiatives, such as building an algorithm in PySpark to rank 200M+ businesses to generate viable sales leads. Supported full life cycles of all outbound marketing efforts, including building ML churn and propensity models for hyper targeted campaigns.   ● Prototyped and deployed a Verizon proprietary blending algorithm that combined data from multiple external vendors to create the best in class marketing database for the B2B Organization. The algorithm was streamlined to process 10 Billion base-pair combinations to eliminate redundant business data with a compression rate of 80%. ● Project lead for expanding network footprint for 5G and Fios products from build perspective. Used unsupervised geospatial clustering to identify pockets of opportunities  across footprint for all products. ● Developed classification ML  models and pipelines to rank a businesses propensity to buy a certain network product. Incorporated the propensities in hyper targeted campaigns for top sales prospects. ● Mined Buildings data with no internet that were close to fiber assets , coordinated with field teams to bring them online. The project yielded 3M in sales in a 1 year timeframe with no capital investments.● Managed a marketing team that delivered all out bound B2B marketing campaigns. Delivered a total of 100+ campaigns per quarter with  post campaign metrics tracking and measuring campaign effectiveness, using treat and holdout A/B Testing methodology. ● Successfully migrated the development team to a Hadoop and Hive database  infrastructure , upgrade from SQL Teradata, improving campaign delivery and lead times.
positions.title: Manager Data Science - B2B
positions.description_html:
Mentor a cross functional analytics team of data scientists in the Verizon B2B space. Project lead for data mining initiatives, such as building an algorithm in PySpark to rank 200M+ businesses to generate viable sales leads. Supported full life cycles of all outbound marketing efforts, including building ML churn and propensity models for hyper targeted campaigns.

● Prototyped and deployed a Verizon proprietary blending algorithm that combined data from multiple external vendors to create the best in class marketing database for the B2B Organization. The algorithm was streamlined to process 10 Billion base-pair combinations to eliminate redundant business data with a compression rate of 80%.

● Project lead for expanding network footprint for 5G and Fios products from build perspective. Used unsupervised geospatial clustering to identify pockets of opportunities across footprint for all products.

● Developed classification ML models and pipelines to rank a businesses propensity to buy a certain network product. Incorporated the propensities in hyper targeted campaigns for top sales prospects.

● Mined Buildings data with no internet that were close to fiber assets , coordinated with field teams to bring them online. The project yielded 3M in sales in a 1 year timeframe with no capital investments.

● Managed a marketing team that delivered all out bound B2B marketing campaigns. Delivered a total of 100+ campaigns per quarter with post campaign metrics tracking and measuring campaign effectiveness, using treat and holdout A/B Testing methodology.

● Successfully migrated the development team to a Hadoop and Hive database infrastructure , upgrade from SQL Teradata, improving campaign delivery and lead times.

positions.subtitle: Verizon
positions.description: Member of Verizon Wireless Database Marketing team, leveraged data to understand customer behavior, helped mitigate churn using machine learning models for targeted campaigns. Primarily analyzed inbound traffic to identify customer pain points in terms of actionable data. Worked with various business units to drive actions that reduced churn and improved customer experience.●	Identified operational inefficiencies faced by the customer service reps. As a result, recommended updates to the UI saved valuable customer time by an average of 31 sec per compass session. On average impacting 700K calls a month, as a result preserving 245K in incremental revenue.●	Conducted NLP sentiment analysis of valuable customer feedback, using Python. As a result, saving manual labor of sorting through large volume customer responses. This process is streamlined and used for Twitter feed analysis.●	Developed a flask web app to identify customer churn clusters, list of customers that are churning at a higher rate then the entire base. The GUI allows navigation and segmentation using all combinations of customer features. These  insights are used to derive customer specific action plan. ●	Used decision trees to identify segments of customers who are at a risk to port to competition, treated these customers with Competitive Price Match offers in order to retain these customers. Interim, saving 174k in incremental revenue.
positions.title: Data Scientist
positions.description_html:
Member of Verizon Wireless Database Marketing team, leveraged data to understand customer behavior, helped mitigate churn using machine learning models for targeted campaigns. Primarily analyzed inbound traffic to identify customer pain points in terms of actionable data. Worked with various business units to drive actions that reduced churn and improved customer experience.

● Identified operational inefficiencies faced by the customer service reps. As a result, recommended updates to the UI saved valuable customer time by an average of 31 sec per compass session. On average impacting 700K calls a month, as a result preserving 245K in incremental revenue.

● Conducted NLP sentiment analysis of valuable customer feedback, using Python. As a result, saving manual labor of sorting through large volume customer responses. This process is streamlined and used for Twitter feed analysis.

● Developed a flask web app to identify customer churn clusters, list of customers that are churning at a higher rate then the entire base. The GUI allows navigation and segmentation using all combinations of customer features. These insights are used to derive customer specific action plan.

● Used decision trees to identify segments of customers who are at a risk to port to competition, treated these customers with Competitive Price Match offers in order to retain these customers. Interim, saving 174k in incremental revenue.

experience.title: Data Scientist
experience.description: Metis is a full-time, three month data science bootcamp focusing on machine learning, statistics, programming,  natural language processing, database management, and visualization.  Completed five projects and demonstrated knowledge in supervised and unsupervised learning, NLP, classification, A/B Testing and regression.Demos available at URL: smeetvikani.github.ioSelected Projects: Twitch Comments NLP: ●	Analyzed twitch user comment data to find 5 best minutes of footage in a 6+ hour video. Used unsupervised clustering and NLP techniques to extract topics of discussion during the best plays of the stream.  ●	As a result developed an interactive flask/D3 App that would find and recommend best plays for any video on twitch.Photo to playlist: ●	Extracted emotional features from images using the AWS Rekognition interface. Modeled song lyrics to create a recommended playlist based on users current mood. ●	Used a glove corpus of 1.2M word embedding in 100D vector space  to find the cosine distance between the lyrics and the emotions. ●	As a result, built an app that would readily analyze user submitted picture and output emotions and a recommended playlist real-time. Used Car Price Prediction Model: ●	Used linear regression modeling to predict used cars prices. Scraped records from Carfax website using selenium. Modeled data using Scikit-learn and Stats-models. ●	As a result, the regularized and cross-validated model accurately predicted car prices with 83% accuracy and a low RMSE.AirBnB New User Behavior Classification: ●	Analyzed records of new user web activity to predict and classify their destinations, between US and Non-US. Tested and tuned various models such as SVM and Random Forest, best performing model was logistic regression.  ●	As a result, model was able to predict US users from around the world with a 82% recall rate. Accuracy and Recall were balanced using a custom cost function.
experience.description_html:
Metis is a full-time, three month data science bootcamp focusing on machine learning, statistics, programming, natural language processing, database management, and visualization. Completed five projects and demonstrated knowledge in supervised and unsupervised learning, NLP, classification, A/B Testing and regression.

Demos available at URL: smeetvikani.github.io
Selected Projects:

Twitch Comments NLP:
● Analyzed twitch user comment data to find 5 best minutes of footage in a 6+ hour video. Used unsupervised clustering and NLP techniques to extract topics of discussion during the best plays of the stream.
● As a result developed an interactive flask/D3 App that would find and recommend best plays for any video on twitch.

Photo to playlist:
● Extracted emotional features from images using the AWS Rekognition interface. Modeled song lyrics to create a recommended playlist based on users current mood.
● Used a glove corpus of 1.2M word embedding in 100D vector space to find the cosine distance between the lyrics and the emotions.
● As a result, built an app that would readily analyze user submitted picture and output emotions and a recommended playlist real-time.

Used Car Price Prediction Model:
● Used linear regression modeling to predict used cars prices. Scraped records from Carfax website using selenium. Modeled data using Scikit-learn and Stats-models.
● As a result, the regularized and cross-validated model accurately predicted car prices with 83% accuracy and a low RMSE.


AirBnB New User Behavior Classification:
● Analyzed records of new user web activity to predict and classify their destinations, between US and Non-US. Tested and tuned various models such as SVM and Random Forest, best performing model was logistic regression.
● As a result, model was able to predict US users from around the world with a 82% recall rate. Accuracy and Recall were balanced using a custom cost function.

experience.title: Manager Data Department

During the migration, created a data pipeline to validate, reformat and their data before merging into our production database on SQL.●Devised, coordinated, and conducted a mass data cleansing initiative to purge redundant customer records, reducing the database by 20%, which interim led to increase in billing efficiency.●Automated process to send documents to customs via scripting. Prior to the automation, this process took 10 min of manual labor per document. Geodis is worlds leading freight forwarding company with a global presence in 60+ countries. Managed a Data Department consisting of 4 Data Analysts.
●Project lead for data migration during acquisition of our competitor, OHL Logistics. During the migration, created a data pipeline to validate, reformat and their data before merging into our production database on SQL.
●Devised, coordinated, and conducted a mass data cleansing initiative to purge redundant customer records, reducing the database by 20%, which interim led to increase in billing efficiency.
●Automated process to send documents to customs via scripting. Prior to the automation, this process took 10 min of manual labor per document. This script was adopted in three countries.
●Performed A/B Testing to define customer and user workflow for the TMS system.

projects.title: Movie Search Webpage
projects.description: - Created webpage with search engine that allows user search movie data stored in local database using PHP, CSS, HTML, AJAX and SQL database. - Downloaded movie data from IMDB API with PHP and stored into SQL database. projects.title: Game of Greedy Snake Artificial Intelligence (AI)

projects.title: Personal Data Management

experience.description_html:
▪ Doubled book of business by creating pipeline in e-commerce, consulting, non-profit, and healthcare industries, leveraging expert experience of government contracts, RFP processes, budgeting cycles, and funding streams.
▪ Perform data maturity assessments, including creating data governance structure, enriching database with novel user information, identifying key gaps in data reporting in relation to strategic goals, designing set of standard operating procedures to execute data processes, and presenting data analysis findings to senior stakeholders.
▪ Strategically manage complex situations involving multiple stakeholders and industries by assessing industry and competitive landscape, identifying areas of strategic financial focus, and developing growth opportunities through utilization of targeted data sets and data-storytelling.
▪ Lead client and industry workshops to identify and evaluate workflow needs, pain points, and evolving clients’ needs to make tailored recommendations.
▪ Develop strategies to identify challenges, improve efficiency, and reduce costs by providing a framework grounded in value creation (WTP, price, cost, and WTS) and pairing it with real-world analysis of risk, return, and capacity.
▪ Analyze and interpret complex data sets including k means, revenue, and cohort analysis to create strategic alignment and optimize operations and growth.

experience.title: Chief Executive Officer: Superintendent
experience.description: ▪ Managed operations of a nationally recognized school district with an annual operating budget of over $121M.▪ Directed executive leadership team by setting KPI, developing performance goals, providing oversight and support for project management across multiple functions, and collaborating to create data-driven recommendations to the Board of Trustees.▪ Managed over 800 union employees through the COVID-19 pandemic to become one of the few districts to have schools open throughout the pandemic while providing quality services in a safe environment. Brought back in-person over 5,000 staff and students to work and school by creatively restructuring our logistical schedules and operational procedures, and modifying personnel protocols.▪ Negotiated with labor unions during the pandemic to agree on safety protocols and working conditions to maintain a motivated workforce and create a culture that embodies team mentality. Have extensive experience in complex and dynamic HR management.▪ Maintained a tax levy increase of 0% while adding investments and programs by reallocating and prioritizing resources.▪ Implemented communication strategy to control the narrative and influence the perspective of all stakeholders.

recommendations: Albert Gashi “June was on my team at Anaconda for over two years, during which he played a pivotal role in managing our most critical relationships on the Partner and Alliances team. In that time, he was responsible for initiating new partnerships with some of the largest tech firms in the world, including IBM, Microsoft, Intel, Snowflake, Lenovo, and AWS, while also maintaining and expanding existing relationships. In two specific instances, June successfully negotiated complex technical integration partnerships with two Fortune 100 tech firms. These negotiations involved their engineering and business development teams and spanned several months. June orchestrated internal resources while maintaining the necessary velocity to finalize agreements that positively impacted our fiscal plans. His deep understanding of data science, machine learning, and AI, coupled with his ability to articulate these concepts to non-technical audiences, was invaluable. In a company filled with “A” players, June stood out. Often, his role required him to marshal internal resources to deliver on the vision of a partnership. He effectively communicated with me and the rest of the C-suite, clearly demonstrating the value and necessity of dedicating resources to specific partnerships. June was one of the few people I could rely on for clarity regarding partner situations. He had a remarkable ability to break down complex problems into their core components, making them easier to address. I do not say this lightly—June’s impact on Anaconda was immense, and I would work with him again without hesitation.”

Carly (Tschantz) Grandfield “June has been my counterpart in the AI partnerships space, and his knowledge, experience and operational mindset has made him part of a respected cohort of colleagues I rely on for insights and perspective on the market. His ability to piece together workstreams and activities to serve a larger strategic vision is unmatched. Our world is always a balancing act of outcomes vs outputs and ensuring the ROI attached to all outputs drive an outcome. June exemplifies how this can be done at scale and benefiting both startup and large technology companies he engages with.”

name: Allen Zhang
city: New York, New York, United States
about: I graduated from Rutgers University with a double major in Computer Science and Economics. I am a Software Development Engineer in Selling Partner Support at Amazon working on feature engineering tools for MLs to fight fraud and detect risky transactions.

positions.subtitle: Amazon
positions.description: - SDE on a feature computation and storage team providing tools for machine learning scientists to build models to evaluate risk of transactions and events- Wrote multi-threaded processes to efficiently process hundreds of GB of batch data for calculation and storage in Java- Worked with AWS Lambda and AWS EMR to collect data and upload computed data into S3 and DynamoDB- Used AWS CDK to develop robust and flexible service with infrastructure as code- Implemented AWS Lambda function to publish metrics to Cloudwatch for datasheets and featureusage across regions and created dashboards for monitoring workflows- Design and implement project to migrate legacy services to native AWS services using StepFunction, Lambda, EMR, and S3 to simulate machine learning features for model training- Use AWS Athena to perform SQL queries for data validation during migration- Implemented scripts using AWS Batch Jobs and AWS Kinesis Firehose to remove unused data inDynamodDB to reduce IMR by estimated 50k per month- Served as technical POC for 2023 PBDD peak event for scaling, ensuring services were adequatelyscaled and processed over 3 million+ TPS during the peak event
positions.title: Software Developer
positions.description_html:
- SDE on a feature computation and storage team providing tools for machine learning scientists to build models to evaluate risk of transactions and events
- Wrote multi-threaded processes to efficiently process hundreds of GB of batch data for calculation and storage in Java
- Worked with AWS Lambda and AWS EMR to collect data and upload computed data into S3 and DynamoDB
- Used AWS CDK to develop robust and flexible service with infrastructure as code
- Implemented AWS Lambda function to publish metrics to Cloudwatch for datasheets and feature
usage across regions and created dashboards for monitoring workflows
- Design and implement project to migrate legacy services to native AWS services using Step
Function, Lambda, EMR, and S3 to simulate machine learning features for model training
- Use AWS Athena to perform SQL queries for data validation during migration
- Implemented scripts using AWS Batch Jobs and AWS Kinesis Firehose to remove unused data in
DynamodDB to reduce IMR by estimated 50k per month
- Served as technical POC for 2023 PBDD peak event for scaling, ensuring services were adequately
scaled and processed over 3 million+ TPS during the peak event

experience.title: Student Researcher
experience.description: Rutgers ARESTY Summer Science ProgramBank Regulation and Supervision (with Prof. Eugene White)-Accepted to a selective summer research program to work full-time with faculty-Gathered Office of Comptroller of Currency (OCC) bank examiner records and qualitativedata for over 80 banks in New York City from 1887 to 1908- Helped create first dataset in the field of economic history to capture such a completepicture of the NYC financial landscape during this time period- Analyzed data on bank balance sheet, capital adequacy, excessive loans, earnings, management, etc. to determine effectiveness of OCC regulation- Wrote Excel VBA macros to sort and standardize thousands of entries and used pivot tables to illustrate data- Used Microsoft Access to create a database containing records for over 80 banks- Implemented a Java program to standardize over 12,000 image files using the bank charternumber, date, and page number to make files searchable- Presented research and findings to fellow researchers and professors at a researchsymposium
experience.description_html:
Rutgers ARESTY Summer Science Program
Bank Regulation and Supervision (with Prof. Eugene White)
-Accepted to a selective summer research program to work full-time with faculty
-Gathered Office of Comptroller of Currency (OCC) bank examiner records and qualitative
data for over 80 banks in New York City from 1887 to 1908
- Helped create first dataset in the field of economic history to capture such a complete
picture of the NYC financial landscape during this time period
- Analyzed data on bank balance sheet, capital adequacy, excessive loans, earnings, management, etc. to determine effectiveness of OCC regulation
- Wrote Excel VBA macros to sort and standardize thousands of entries and used pivot tables to illustrate data
- Used Microsoft Access to create a database containing records for over 80 banks
- Implemented a Java program to standardize over 12,000 image files using the bank charter
number, date, and page number to make files searchable
- Presented research and findings to fellow researchers and professors at a research
symposium

publications.title: Toward an Integrated Route to the Vernonia Allenes and Related Sesquiterpenoids
publications.subtitle: Beilstein Journal of Organic Chemistry
publications.description: The synthesis of a model endocyclic allene related to the vernonia allenes is described. Fragmentation of a suitable decalin derivative gave the simplified germacrane scaffold. Computational analysis of this and related substrates provides insight into the stereoelectronic requirements of C–C fragmentation. The overall strategy to access these and other sesquiterpenes and the key steps in the present sequence are also discussed.

projects.title: Simple Network File System
projects.description: · Implemented with a multithreaded server (using C and sockets), which executes file read/write operations (using a lock and a hash map to ensure sequential access to the file system), a client-side library, which handles calls from an application and communicates with the server, and some client applications performing file read/write.

projects.title: Fast Trajectory Re-planning
projects.description: · Used depth-first search to generate mazes in grid world.· Implemented a binary heap from an array (C++) to use as a priority queue.· Applied repeated A* search to find a shortest path in the maze.· Visualized how searching proceeds when using different heuristics for estimating remaining cost and different tie breaking strategies among grid cells.

projects.title: Personal Data Search Engine
projects.description: · Retrieved personal data from Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, and Gmail.· Parsed raw data and extracted three collections of information including personal contacts, occurred events and keywords in descriptive texts (Python, PyMongo).· Stored these as documents in MongDB, and provided a web interface to query and display data (Python, Django).

publications.title: Dymeclin (mRNA sequence), 70RC2.15
publications.subtitle: National Center for Biotechnology Information
publications.description: Landoltia punctata cDNAs were reversed transcribed from polyA-selected mRNAs. SfiIA and SfiIB linkers were added to the cDNAs via the primers used to synthesize first and second strand cDNAs. The cDNAs were cut with SfiI to generate SfiI sticky ends, and the cDNAs were directionally ligated into SfiIA and SfiIB-cut plasmid vector pTriplEX2. Recombinant plasmids were transformed into E. coli strain DH5a.

publications.title: NADH-ubiquinone oxidoreductase subunit (mRNA sequence), 70RC4,15
publications.subtitle: National Center for Biotechnology Information
publications.description: NADH dehydrogenase (ubiquinone)) is an enzyme of the respiratory chains of myriad organisms from bacteria to humans. It catalyzes the transfer of electrons from NADH to coenzyme Q10 (CoQ10) and, in eukaryotes, it is located in the inner mitochondrial membrane. It is one of the "entry enzymes" of cellular respiration or oxidative phosphorylation in the mitochondria.

publications.subtitle: National Center for Biotechnology Information
publications.description: These enzymes responsible for cleaving pyroglutamate (pGlu) from the N-terminal end of specialized proteins. The N-terminal pGlu protects these proteins from proteolysis by other proteases until the pGlu is removed by a PGP.

publications.title: Thioredoxin (mRNA sequence), 70RC1.14
publications.subtitle: National Center for Biotechnology Information
publications.description: By altering their redox state, TRX regulates the functions of at least 30 target proteins, some of which are enzymes and transcription factors. It also plays an important role in the defense against oxidative stress by directly reducing hydrogen peroxide and certain radicals, and by serving as a reductant for peroxiredoxins.

publications.title: Unicode Optical Character Recognition Using Neural Networks
publications.subtitle: International Journal of Science, Engineering and Technology Research
publications.description: Shows how to convert the text documents into the software translated the Unicode text. Unicodeis nothing but the encoding standard in which each letter, number or symbol is assigned a unique numeric value which may be used with different languages. It involves scanning the document and then recognizing each and every character of the printed text so that it can be converted to Unicode.

projects.title: Microsoft Malware Detection
projects.description: Malware is any piece of software that was written with the intent of doing harm to data, devices or to people. In the past few years, the malware industry has grown very rapidly that, the syndicates invest heavily in technologies to evade traditional protection, forcing the anti-malware groups/communities to build more robust software to detect and terminate these attacks.The aim of the project is--To identify whether a given piece of file/software is malware.

projects.title: Quora Question Pairs
projects.description: Quora is a place to gain and share knowledge—about anything. It’s a platform to ask questions and connect with people who contribute unique insights and quality answers. This empowers people to learn from each other and to better understand the world.Over 100 million people visit Quora every month, so it's no surprise that many people ask similarly worded questions. Multiple questions with the same intent can cause seekers to spend more time finding the best answer to their question and make writers feel they need to answer multiple versions of the same question. Quora values canonical questions because they provide a better experience to active seekers and writers, and offer more value to both of these groups in the long term.The project aims to:-Identify which questions asked on Quora are duplicates of questions that have already been asked.-This could be useful to instantly provide answers to questions that have already been answered.-We are tasked with predicting whether a pair of questions are duplicates or not.

projects.title: Stackoverflow Tag predictor
projects.description: Stack Overflow is the largest, most trusted online community for developers to learn, share their programming knowledge, and build their careers.Stack Overflow is something which every programmer use one way or another. Each month, over 50 million developers come to Stack Overflow to learn, share their knowledge, and build their careers. It features questions and answers on a wide range of topics in computer programming. The website serves as a platform for users to ask and answer questions, and, through membership and active participation, to vote questions and answers up or down and edit questions and answers in a fashion similar to a wiki or Digg. As of April 2014 Stack Overflow has over 4,000,000 registered users, and it exceeded 10,000,000 questions in late August 2015. Based on the type of tags assigned to questions, the top eight most discussed topics on the site are Java, JavaScript, C#, PHP, Android, jQuery, Python, and HTML.The project aims to -Suggest the tags based on the content that was there in the question posted on StackOverflow.

projects.title: Amazon Fine Food Reviews(Semantic Analysis)
projects.description: Amazon focuses on e-commerce and customers can add comments and reviews about the product.This is a dataset which consists of reviews of fine foods from Amazon. They can be positive or negative. This project aims to:- Predict the rating of the given reviews of the product using different featurisers like BOW , tf-idf, average wordtovec-Learn about Dimensionality Reduction ( PCA and t-Sne )-Build models to predict the rate of the reviews using various machine learning algorithms- Knn, Naive Bayes, Logistic Regression

projects.title: Maze-Runner : Finding an optimal path
projects.description: The aim is to find the shortest path from source to the destination using searching algorithms - Depth First Search (DFS), Breadth First Search(BFS), A*(euclidean) and A*(manhattan). After generating mazes for various dimensions, we implement the algorithms on each maze and find the average shortest path to reach the destination and analyze which algorithm outputs the most optimal path. Different constraints are imposed on the maze generator function to compare the output for all the algorithms.

projects.title: Distribution for occurrence of Atlantic Hurricanes
projects.description: The project is to find the best possible distribution for the occurrences of two categories of Atlantic Hurricanes - Category 4 and Category 5.

publications.title: Mechanical-Bond-Protected, Air-Stable Radicals
publications.subtitle: J. Am. Chem. Soc.
publications.description: Radical templation centered around a heterotrisradical tricationic inclusion complex DB•+⊂DAPQT2(•+), assembled from an equimolar mixture of a disubstituted 4,4′-bipyridinium radical cation (DB•+) and an asymmetric cyclophane bisradical dication (DAPQT2(•+)), affords a symmetric [2]catenane (SC·7PF6) and an asymmetric [2]catenane (AC·7PF6) on reaction of the 1:1 complex with diazapyrene and bipyridine, respectively. Both these highly charged [2]catenanes have been isolated as air-stable monoradicals and characterized by EPR spectroscopy. X-ray crystallography suggests that the unpaired electrons are delocalized in each case across two inner 4,4′-bipyridinium (BIPY2+) units forming a mixed-valence (BIPY2)•3+ state inside both [2]catenanes, an observation which is in good agreement with spin-density calculations using density functional theory. Electrochemical studies indicate that by replacing the BIPY2+ units in homo[2]catenane HC•7+—composed of two mechanically interlocked cyclobis(paraquat-p-phenylene) rings—with “zero”, one, and two more highly conjugated diazapyrenium dication (DAP2+) units, respectively, a consecutive series of five, six, and seven redox states can be accessed in the resulting SC·7PF6 (0, 4+, 6+, 7+, and 8+), HC·7PF6 (0, 2+, 4+, 6+, 7+, and 8+), and AC·7PF6 (0, 1+, 2+, 4+, 6+, 7+, and 8+), respectively. These unique [2]catenanes present a promising prototype for the fabrication of high-density data memories.

publications.title: Radically promoted formation of a molecular lasso
publications.subtitle: Chem. Sci.
publications.description: Two potential viologen-based molecular lasso precursors—both composed of a 4,4′-bipyridinium (BIPY2+) unit as part of a rope appended to a cyclobis(paraquat-p-phenylene) (CBPQT4+) loop—that have been designed to mimic the threading/unthreading motion of lasso peptides, have been synthesised and characterised. Solution and solid-state experiments reveal that, when the BIPY2+ unit in the rope and the CBPQT4+ loop are connected by a bulky linker, no lasso-like conformational transformation is observed between the different redox states on account of steric effects. In sharp contrast, when the linker size is small, the molecule can be switched between (i) a free rope-like conformation in its fully oxidised state and (ii) a self-entangled lasso-like conformation under reducing conditions employing either chemical or electrochemical stimuli: the BIPY˙+ unit in the rope resides inside the cavity of the CBPQT2(˙+) loop, forming a pseudo[1]rotaxane. The switching process is reversible and stereochemically unambiguous. This research shows how tiny structural differences can induce significantly different self-complexing properties and sheds light on designing functional artificial actuators.

publications.title: A Redox-Active Bistable Molecular Switch Mounted inside a Metal–Organic Framework
publications.subtitle: J. Am. Chem. Soc. (Equal Contribution)
publications.description: We describe the incorporation of a bistable mechanically interlocked molecule (MIM) into a robust Zr-based metal–organic framework (MOF), NU-1000, by employing a post-synthetic functionalization protocol. On average, close to two bistable [2]catenanes can be incorporated per repeating unit of the hexagonal channels of NU-1000. The reversible redox-switching of the bistable [2]catenanes is retained inside the MOF, as evidenced by solid-state UV-vis-NIR reflectance spectroscopy and cyclic voltammetry. This research demonstrates that bistable MIMs are capable of exhibiting robust dynamics inside the nanopores of a MOF.

projects.title: SMS RemindMe

projects.title: WatchMe
projects.description: Watch Me - is an embedded systems project in which we developed the hardware, software, and product design for a wireless wristband device that measures the heart rate and oxygen levels of a person to autonomously determine critical health conditions in a patient, and trigger a call for assistance. The device can call several peers of contact, which can be family, neighbors, and friends.

projects.title: Implementation of Conway's Game of Life Using Arduino and a large LED matrix
projects.description: Designing and construction of a 48x36 LED matrix that was controlled by an Arduino Mega that had been multiplexed to the board. The arduino was then programmed to use that LED matrix as a screen and display a representation of Conway's Game of Life. The Game of Life is zero player game that is a two dimensional cellular automaton. Using an orthogonal grid of squares which can be considered either in “live or dead” states, patterns can be generated from iterating a set of rules. Originally, the game was conceptualized on a Go board with the black and white game pieces representing the live or dead states. All files and documentation can be found here------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B9UxvPtb7-6iZzN3eTFBaEsxdzBVNDhDMVJlZHZVRVEySHhR/view?usp=sharing

recommendations: Daniel Settanni “What impresses me most about Nik is his ability to confront the challenges of a project, whether technical or interpersonal in nature, head on and with extremely successful results. He tackles new and unfamiliar technologies with ease. Nik also has a positive attitude that is both refreshing and contagious. I count him among the most talented people I've worked with. Nik and I worked together on multiple projects over the 2010 to 2012 time frame.”

Giselle Ri, PMP “I had the pleasure of working with Nik during Colgate’s implementation of BPC 7.5 NW for Capital Planning. Nik has without a doubt very strong technical skills. He is well versed in all aspects of SAP BPC. He has a deep understanding of the application’s structure and capabilities. Nik utilized his knowledge of SAP Web Dynpro and BADIs to generate master data on the fly and enhance business process flows. From a project management perspective, his ability to quickly grasp business processes and ask the right questions enables him to manage projects successfully. But what impressed me the most about Nik is his ability to think outside the box and come up with creative solutions that meet business needs. Nik goes above and beyond to deliver a world-class solution. Whether he was developing a system, driving meetings or managing projects, Nik demonstrated that he is a self-starter and a well rounded business professional. Dependable, hard-working and a joy to work with, Nik fosters a friendly and productive work environment. I know Nik will excel in any endeavor he takes on. I would appreciate the opportunity to work with him again.”

publications.title: A Controlled Release PLGA Bupivacaine Construct and its Effect on Chondrocytes
publications.description: Controlling osteoarthritic pain has emerged as a major health care challenge. Available treatments are either cytotoxic or addictive and therefore there is an urgent need to develop alternative treatment options. We previously developed a liposomal-alginate construct to improve local anesthetic delivery as a potential chronic pain management treatment. In order to further improve this construct, we have designed a PLGA-alginate construct which extends drug release for at least 35 days. The current studies describe the characterization of this construct and its effect on chondrocyte viability and function

projects.title: Object Recognition
projects.description: Created a service which allows the user to take a photo of any product, and use two-step classification to identify the type of the product (eg. bottle, bag, etc.) and then the brand of the product.For brand recognition, we used transfer learning. We took a pre-trained model on image net and re-trained the classification layer to predict and classify a few brands. After the product has been identified, the user can choose to shop for the product on e-commerce websites.Used Darknet, an open source neural network framework; Flask framework for the service and Selenium web driver

projects.title: Visualization of Biconnected Components
projects.description: Implemented a visualization of the algorithm to find biconnected components and articulation points in a graph. The visualization is meant to help understand the working of the algorithm as each step and each call during the execution of the program is visualized and user can see how the components are found step-by-step.Adapted from the open source visualizations built by David Galles from USFCAUsed JavaScript, HTML, CSS

projects.title: Travel Reservation System (JSP, MySQL)
projects.description: - Led a four-person team to build a Web App with JSP for travelers to search, book flights and select seats.- Personal responsibilities in implementation of account registrations, user sign in, sign out, manager’s account, account settings, flight searching, flight statistics and reservation making.- Designed and built the UI and the database with MySQL and implemented queries to store, retrieve and manipulate data.

projects.title: Patient Cohorts Analysis (Python, Data Mining and Analytics)
projects.description: - Developed patient attribute weights learning algorithm based on partially labeled data to improve patient clustering quality.- Utilized clustering algorithms (K-means and Hierarchical Clustering) to partition patients into clusters.- Designed and implemented a workflow discovery algorithm to extract features of different treatment patterns.- Performed statistical analysis and significance tests to mine the association between patient cohorts and treatment processes.

projects.title: VIT-PLA: Visual Interactive Tool of Process Log Analysis (Java, Data Mining and Analytics)
projects.description: - Participated in developing Java-based and Web-based data visualization analytics tools – Visual Interactive Tool of Process Log Analysis (VIT-PLA), which is published in KDD 2017 (Top Conference on Data Mining).- Designed algorithms to optimize alignment outcomes, reduced alignment matrix length by 30%.- Implemented a novel time-warping-based pairwise process for trace similarity measure.- Deployed the Web-based version on AWS to increase scaling.

projects.title: Travel Journal App (Android)
projects.description: - Led a four-person team to build an Android app for travelers to keep a journal with tags, photos and the location.- Developed the map view using Google Maps API to show the places the user has been.- Implemented the location service to automatically update the current location while editing the journal.- Designed and implemented the User Interface which follows the Google Material Design principles.- Built a database with Google Firebase and implemented queries to store and retrieve data for user interaction.

projects.title: Handwriting Recognition (Python, Deep learning)
projects.description: - Implemented image classifier for handwriting recognition using TensorFlow framework.- Trained deep learning with convolutional neural network(CNN) with 50k with MNIST dataset images.- Utilized max-pooling in neural network in order to extract handwriting features.- Performed image augment in training and achieved 92.2% accuracy of image classification.

projects.title: Timeline.JS (Data Visualization)
projects.description: - Building a JS library to perform process log visualization. Designed the library with another programmer, utilizing D3.js and ES6 based Webpack.

projects.title: Stock Prediction (Web Application)
projects.description: - Built a RESTful Web App using MVC architecture and machine learning techniques.- Utilized 3-layer Artificial Neural Networks to predict short-term stock prices, achieved 90% precision.- Designed and developed the UI with AngularJS, Bootstrap, developed back-end interaction with Python Flask.- Implemented database queries to perform historical stock data collection and data cleaning.

projects.title: Traffic Monitoring System (Web Application)
projects.description: - Collaborated with other programmers to implement a web application providing traffic conditions and travel suggestions.- Implemented whole UI, applied Here Map API.- Designed algorithms to provide travel suggestions based on historical traffic and weather data.

projects.title: Stock Portfolio Management System

projects.title: Web Based Stock Forecaster
