name: Harsh Rajkumar
about:
I am a Computer Science graduate from Rutgers University, New Brunswick. My area of concentration was Machine Learning - Recommendation Systems, Smart Cities & Natural Language Processing.

Paper Publication: Understanding User Behavior in Car Sharing Services Through The Lens of Mobility: Mixing Qualitative and Quantitative Studies (UbiComp’21 - ACM IMWUT Journal Vol. 4, No. 4, Article 156)

I have worked on multiple projects involving High Throughput Backend services, Fault-Tolerant System Design, Deep Learning & Machine Learning involving Time-Series data, Smart Cities - Car Sharing Services, Knowledge Graphs translational embedding-based recommender systems, and Multi-Task Transformer architecture-based language understanding models.

I have experience creating SOTA models and the backbone of Natural Language Understanding Platform which included but wasn't limited to designing a highly available & resilient backend database(NoSQL MongoDB), Horizontally Load-Balanced Application architecture, and designing software services from the ground up.

Previously, I have also worked on -
A context-aware Search Algorithm that improved itself continuously based on click-through rate & feedback received. It also had Auto-Suggest and Type-Ahead to guide users on better search queries.

Product Insights Reporting Systems which involved designing data models to provide customers insights into product usage and for continuous self-improvement of product services.

I won Light Bulb Award for the Most Innovative & Sustainable Idea in MicroTyco Challenge organized by WildHearts NGO and my team was a finalist for the Barclays Group Technology Awards.

I welcome any connections and opportunities that will further enhance my knowledge base. Let's grab a cup of coffee and exchange our thoughts and ideas. Feel free to connect with me via my email at harsh2kumar@gmail.com

publications.title: Understanding User Behavior in Car Sharing Services Through The Lens of Mobility: Mixing Qualitative and Quantitative Studies
publications.subtitle: (UbiComp'21) Proceedings of the ACM on Interactive Mobile Wearable and Ubiquitous Technologies[IMWUT]
publications.description: Qualitative and quantitative user studies can reveal valuable insights into user behavior, which in turn can assist system designers in providing better user experiences. Car sharing (e.g., Zipcar and car2go), as an emerging App-based online shared mobility mode, has been increasing exponentially worldwide in recent years. However, to date, comprehensive user behavior in car sharing systems has not been investigated, which is essential for understanding their characteristics and promotion roadblocks. With the goal of understanding various facets of user behavior in these systems, in this paper, we performed a qualitative and quantitative user study by adopting a mixed-methods approach. We designed an attitude-aware online survey with a set of qualitative questions to perceive people’s subjective attitudes to online car sharing. We then quantitatively analyzed a year long real world car sharing operation data which involves over 68,000 unique users & over 587,850 usages. We dissected this attitude-free data to understand the objective car sharing user behavior from different dimensions, e.g., spatial, temporal, and demographic. Furthermore, we conducted a comparative study by utilizing one-year data from other two representative cities to show if the obtained findings from earlier data may be generalizable. We also do a case study by designing a user behavior-aware usage prediction model (i.e., BeXGBoost) based on findings from our user study (e.g., unbalanced spatiotemporal usage patterns, weekly regularity, demographic-related usage difference, and low-frequency revisitation), which is the basis for car sharing service station deployment and vehicle rebalancing. We summarize the findings obtained from our study about unique user behavior in online car sharing systems, combined with some detailed discussions about implications for design.

courses.title: Design and Analysis of Algorithms/Advanced Algorithms

projects.title: Mapping Users to Restaurants using Hybrid Collaborative Filtering
projects.description: We built a Content/Item/User based Hybrid collaborative filtering model that recommends users to Restaurants based on their taste profile respecting the geographical proximities of the user. We worked with the Yelp Academic Dataset, performed sentiment analysis of users to do better item based filtering, bining and bloom filtering to accommodate the expected geographical boundaries of users.

projects.title: Polyhedron feasibility using Triangle Algorithm
projects.description: We used Triangle algorithm which solves the Convex Hull Membership problem to solve Polyhedron feasibility using Farkas' Lemma. CHM problem occurs extensively in theoretical machine learning. Our Polyhedron feasibility using Triangle algorithm can be used in various ML applications.

projects.title: Colorizing Grayscale Images using CNN's
projects.description: We trained a Convolutional Neural Network on Grayscale images to learn 'Representation Patch' to Pixel function to efficiently reduce the color Gamut ("set of crayons") and color the given Grayscale image to a full RGB based pixel image. We learned that a pixel can efficiently be learned by capturing its surrounding pixels and learning a relative function instead to Grayscale pixel - Colored Pixel mapping, thus, we define a 3x3 pixel matrix as a 'patch' and learn matrix to colored pixel mapping. We also reduce the color gamut by defining a 'Representation Color' for each possible color by clustering 256x256x256 color values of a pixel into a few clusters and using the cluster heads to color the image making the CNN learn only 'Representation colors' instead of the entire color gamut.

projects.title: Clustering Analysis and Classification of Instagram
projects.description: The project dealt with clustering Instagram accounts and classifying them into multiple classes. The benefit of this application is to provide insight into the underlying clusters across top accounts on one of the most influential social networks, and also has business and content consumption impacts. The main stumbling blocks were collecting and coding the data, and clustering appropriately for the mixture of numerical and categorical attributes. Scale and timeline was controlled by showing analysis and classification for the top 100 accounts.

projects.title: Probabilistic Agent Learning for Target Hunting
projects.description: The Project focuses itself on probabilistically hunting a target in an arbitrary landscape composed of cells with different difficulties of searching a target. I designed a learning algorithm to build an agent that models knowledge/belief about a system probabilistically and updates its knowledge using Bayesian learning approach to direct efficient future directions. We extend our algorithm to two use cases: 1) When the target is stationary 2) When the target is moving. We also study agent's dependance on various cost functions and strategies of search and compare them for minimization of total searches taken to successfully hunt the target.

projects.title: Smart Minesweeper AI
projects.description: Wrote a Minesweeper AI agent capable of playing/solving the game deterministically in an arbitrarily distributed mine field. This was done by mathematically modeling the logic of a rational player by devising constraint satisfaction problems and drawing inferences. We broke down the problem at each stage as solving a Linear Program accepting only integral solutions {0,1} indicating a cell containing a mine or not, respectively. We also investigated "Chain of influence" for each cell - a series of solved cells that lead to a conclusion about any particular unsolved cell in the Mine map and also how the AI agent can adapt when clues on opening a cell are "optimistic" or "cautious" i.e., revealing only partially correct information.

projects.title: University of Queensland,St. Lucia, Australia - Simulation Algorithms for Large Complex Random Networks
projects.description: Worked on Simulation algorithms for large complex random networks for various degree distribution and graph models to study and devise efficient and optimized simulation algorithms for real world problems. I also studied clustering and the speed at which this convergence occurs in random graphs and how the conditioning for degree distribution is dependent on it. Got recognition for producing an improvised version of Havel-Hakimi algorithm to draw a random graph with fixed number of stubs for a graphical degree distribution.

projects.title: Study of Combinatorial Sequences modulo a Positive Integer (Research Project)
projects.description: I worked on Investigating periodicity in last digits of various combinatorial sequences primarily, generalised Bell polynomial, r-Stirling numbers, (r1, r2,......,rp) Stirling numbers, Fubini numbers. My work is focused on development of computational and combinatorial proofs for periodicity in flexible bases and to develop a general function from period of repetition to number of digits thus obtaining congruence relations in the sequence for powers for different bases firstly, 10.

projects.title: Correlation between Social Activity and Structural Centrality Variables for effective communication flow in Social Networks
projects.description: The aim of the project was to find some "influencial" nodes in the graph without using centrality variables like clustering on a node, betweenness centrality etc. but instead using social activity parameters for users on the network such as login count, user activity measures. We then established correlations between these various structural and social activity variables and their combinations if they were viable using MATLAB and R. We initially performed it on a Smaller graph with about 100 nodes and we are trying to extend it to large graphs.

projects.title: Hi.rd - HopHacks
projects.description: Hi.rd is an app that streamlines the process for recruiters and applicants at hackathons and job fairs to give you one tool to keep open with a quick way to share your email and a small template message too with the resume attached!

projects.title: Waves - HackRU
projects.description: An android app to connect with Muse hardware over bluetooth and list out its brain wave readings on the GUI. The reading variations are then used to try and figure out the mood of person.Also the person wearing Muse has the option to tweet his brain readings at the click of a button and pause/continue the readings. The purpose of tweeting brain waves is to create a dataset for future analysis which lacks right now as the hardware is relatively new. Demo involved asking participants to listen to songs having different moods and realizing how Muse readings dropped when listening to songs with calm moods as opposed to songs belonging to genres like heavy metal or hard rock.The project was developed with David Awad, Apoorv Verma and Rob Casale at HackRU

projects.title: Peogle : Google People - HackNY
projects.description: Inspiration : The basic idea was to build a platform where people could search for other people across a variety of social networking websites and view the results in a categorized and organized fashion for easily locating the person they were searching for.Target Users : Everybody who uses social networking websites.API : Google Custom Search Engine (very restricted for free usage and therefore the application performs on a very small scale currently)

projects.title: VOICE.com - HackPSU
projects.description: Inspiration : Reading through the EdTech challenge for HackPSU made me ponder over the kind of difficulties visually impaired and dyslexic students go through while trying to learn. I read online and found out that 'voice tutorials' is a solution which stands common to both these categories of students. Therefore, I decided to come up with this web app which uses VoiceRSS API for Text to Speech conversion of files uploaded in plain text format and provides interactive controls like gesture controls and play a selected text to cater to the special needs of these students.The project currently supports only text files/plain text for text input.Hosted at https://stark-coast-5034.herokuapp.com/ (not working as expected due to some issue with file uploads. Trying to fix the same.Credits : https://github.com/mtschirs/js-objectdetect for image detection

projects.title: Implemented various OS features over basic XV6 basic kernel implementation
projects.description: Academic Project :Implemented various OS features like system calls, libraries to support multi-threading (Kernel level and user level), Copy on Demand etc on basic XV6 implementation by MIT as a part of Operating Systems Design course.

projects.title: Academic Institutional Automation Tool
projects.description: The project was undertaken to automate the learning process and assist faculty and staff in generation of question papers in academic institutions. It was built using technologies like PHP, XHTML/CSS, MySQL on XAMPP framework and included features such as question paper generator, question banks for student reference, discussion forums etc. View AIAT presentation on http://www.scribd.com/doc/188337134/AAIT

projects.title: OCR over Spark
projects.description: Optical character Recognition has made rapid progress in the field of document digitization. Giving ease of digitizing documentation and being able to port them onto a computer is attracting a lot of audience these days.Input to OCR systems are often huge and scanning through each line of the input is costly. The input size here makes the problem a good fit to exploit distributed computing. We aim at parallelizing the data intensive stages throughout the system. This project uses various classifiers defined in Mllib's python library to enable parallel processing of data for effective OCR.

projects.title: Artist-O-Pedia
projects.description: A web app created to assist Artist to create their profile and for music fans to explore their favorite artists, view their profiles, check out their work and enjoy their songs on youtube and spotifyAlso their is support for artists to login using their ids and view stats for their songs and albums.New Artist Profile creation is not a part of this release and as of now site provides for viewing profiles of artist existing in the databaseThere are features like browser local storage based recently viewed display and also an interesting feature called artist roulette which allows users to explore similar artist in an anonymous and random fashion.A website instance is hosted at : http://artistopediav2.herokuapp.com/APIs Used :SpotifyEchonestDynatabletagul for genre tag generationyoutube embedded player

projects.title: x86 Simplified Compiler Design
projects.description: Language: OCAML. Designed and built compiler, interpreter, lexer and parser, on top of simple x86 architecture.

projects.title: Product Taxonomy
projects.description: The project aimed at developing a utility application to provide classification services for various products used within the organization Union Bank of Switzerland (a major financial firm dealing in niche products such as Equities, Options and others) using languages Java, J2EE, XHTML, jQuery and others, Oracle 11g database and Struts2, Spring 3.0(DI/AOP) framework. Product Taxonomy aims at classifying these products and providing their nomenclature on the basis of predefined rules or properties so that various applications across UBS can identify these products in a similar fashion.

projects.title: Heuristic Based Vehicle Routing
projects.description: VRP was formulated to design routes for each vehicle so as to meet the given constraints like minimizing total distance travelled, total time taken and the number of required vehicles. The aim was to find a heuristic based solution to find a near optimal solution for VRP with less computational effort. It was an enriching experience as I worked under the guidance of Dr. Antony Arukia Das from Infosys labs, BengaluruCode was written in JAVA

experience.title: Software Engineer
experience.description: Software Engineer on the Auction Core Engineer Team that owns the service responsible for the Sponsored Products Auction and providing Sponsored Product Ads to search results• Implement and maintain the tier 1 service that performs the auction and allocation for Sponsored Products ads utilizing Spring Framework for dependency injection, hosted in AWS ECS with 99.99% uptime supporting an average of 170k transaction per second and reducing code release time by 50% for Ad Server components •	Design and implement the Late Stage Ranker, a component that filters ads prior to auction, by collaborating with data scientists and running simulations to create a simplified auction function while maintaining ad quality, reducing auction time by 20-30% and generating over $2 million in revenue a year in the US•	Design and implement high traffic deployment CI/CD pipelines using AWS CDK to improve deployment time from over a week to less than a day and automate testing for all Sponsored Products engineers•	Take part in a monthly 24/7 on-call rotation lasting one week to help maintain 99.99% availability by monitoring and responding to incoming issues, helped fine tune high severity alarming to reduce tickets by 25%•

name: Suraj Komarla Amaranarayana
about:
I am a passionate software engineer with a strong focus on building scalable, efficient solutions that drive business transformation. With expertise in cloud services, microservices, full-stack development, and AI/ML, I enjoy solving complex technical challenges and developing systems that optimize performance and enhance user experience. My approach is rooted in delivering robust, secure, and scalable applications while keeping user-centric design at the forefront.

Throughout my career, I’ve had the opportunity to work on diverse projects spanning healthcare, cloud computing, and big data. These experiences have shaped my technical and problem-solving skills, teaching me the following about myself:

• I thrive on architecting and implementing cloud-based and microservices solutions. Whether it’s migrating legacy systems, optimizing data pipelines, or automating infrastructure, I bring a methodical approach to every project.

• I excel at bridging the gap between engineering and business needs. I collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to translate technical concepts into practical, high-impact solutions that align with business goals.

• I am always learning. Staying ahead of the latest in software engineering, cloud platforms, and AI/ML advancements is a priority for me. I actively seek new challenges and technologies to continuously improve my skills.

Professional Skills:
Cloud Computing (AWS, Kubernetes, Terraform) | Microservices Architecture | Full-Stack Development (Java, ReactJS, Python, SpringBoot) | AI/ML (Generative AI, Video/Image Processing) | Data Engineering | Automation | Distributed Systems | GraphQL | PostgreSQL | Kafka | Event-Driven Architecture | Secure Coding Practices

Domain Knowledge:
Healthcare | FinTech | Cloud Infrastructure | AI/ML | Data Security | Enterprise Solutions | Application Development | Technical Leadership | System Scalability

I am always open to connecting with fellow professionals and exploring new opportunities to create impactful software solutions. Feel free to reach out if you’d like to discuss emerging technologies, technical challenges, or collaborate on innovative projects.

The paper contributes to advancing the field of AI-powered video editing and restoration.

publications.title: Vehicle Detection and Tracking for 511 Traffic Cameras With U-Shaped Dual Attention Inception Neural Networks and Spatial-Temporal Map
publications.subtitle: Transportation Research Record: Journal of the Transportation Research Board
publications.description: This paper develops vehicle detection and tracking method for 511 camera networks based on the spatial-temporal map (STMap) as an add-on toolbox for the traveler information system platform. The U-shaped dual attention inception (DAIU) deep-learning model was designed, given the similarities between the STMap vehicle detection task and the medical image segmentation task. The inception backbone takes full advantage of diverse sizes of filters and the flexible residual learning design. The channel attention module augmented the feature extraction for the bottom layer of the UNet. The modified gated attention scheme replaced the skip connection of the original UNet to reduce irrelevant features learned from earlier encoder layers. The designed model was tested on NJ511 traffic cameras for different scenarios covering rainy, snowy, low illumination, and signalized intersections from a key, strategic arterial in New Jersey. The DAIU Net has shown better performance than other mainstream neural networks based on segmentation model evaluation metrics. The proposed scanline vehicle detection was also compared with the state-of-the-art solution for infrastructure-based traffic movement counting solution and demonstrates superior capability. The code for the proposed DAIU model and reference models has been made public with the labeled STMap data to facilitate future research.

publications.title: A Social Distancing Index: Evaluating Navigational Policies on Human Proximity using Crowd Simulations
publications.subtitle: MIG '20: Motion, Interaction and Games
publications.description: The importance of social distancing for public health is well established. However, the policies and regulations regarding occupancy rates have not been designed with this in mind. While there are analytical tools and related measures that are used in practice to evaluate how the design of a built environment serves the needs of its intended occupants, these metrics cannot directly apply to the problem of preventing the spread of infectious diseases such as COVID-19. By using a crowd-based simulator using three levels of behavior and agent control in a given environment, a novel evaluation metric for a space layout can be calculated to reflect the proclivity of maintaining a safe distance throughout the shopping experience. We refer to this metric as the Social Distancing Index (SDI), accounting for the occupancy throughput and number of distance-based violations found. Through a case study of a realistic retail store, we demonstrate the proposed platforms performance and output on multiple scenarios by changing agent-behavior, occupancy rate, and navigational guidelines.

projects.title: Image Classification
projects.description: • Technology Used: Python• Implemented Naive Bayes, Perceptron and Mira Classifier classifiers for classifying digits and faces in the given data set.• The classifiers were trained over the training data set first and then tested over testing data set.• Designed various extraction features to classify digits and detect faces from the images of digits and faces.• Achieved accuracy for testing data is 84% in case of digits and 90% in case of faces.

projects.title: Book Recommendation System
projects.description: • Developed a recommender system that recommended books based on the existing dataset consisting of book preferences of a million users.• Technologies Used : Python, SQL and webpy.• DataSet Used : http://www2.informatik.uni-freiburg.de/~cziegler/BX/

projects.title: MapReduce
projects.description: • Technology Used : Java, Hadoop, MapReduce, AWS • Objective of the project was to parse chess data pgn files and present cumulatives results by MapReduce.• The MapReduce jobs were run on the Amazon Web Services (AWS) Elastic MapReduce Clusters.• It involved calculating games won, lost, percentages of different categories and also extracting and reorganizing other information from each game. • The data set consisted of more than a million games.

projects.title: Fast Trajectory Replanning
projects.description: • Technology Used: JAVA• Developed a grid world environment which generates random mazes of size 101 x 101. • Random maze generator uses Depth First Search to move in random direction and marks the explored cell as unblocked.• Used informed search strategies (heuristic search) to find the path between random start and goal position in the generated maze.• Implemented Repeated Forward, Backward and Adaptive A* search versions to find the path in the maze.

projects.title: Liveness Detection
projects.description: • Language Used : C++ (with OpenCv )• Objective of the project was to develop a software based solution to differentiate between fake and real fingerprints.• I was responsible for implementation of selected features to build the different modules.• The modules were tested on data given by Samsung consisting of thousands of fake and live fingerprints.• The built modules produced better results than existing systems and was submitted to Samsung for Commercial implementation.

projects.title: Online Health System
projects.description: • Technology Used: Html, PHP, MySql• Objective of the project was to develop the entire working module for Health centre of Ism Dhanbad.• The project made the entire process of the health department automated

projects.title: Clinical Design Support System
projects.description: • Objective of the project was to do an extensive study of all the decision based systems.• The project was completed by giving a comparison based final presentation to the head of Department,Ism Dhanbad .

projects.title: Web Development for genco83.com
projects.description: Objective was to develop an online portal for the 1983 Alumni batch of Guru Nanak Dev Engineering College, Ludhiana, India. The portal includes personal and contact information of the Alumni batch. It provides a platform to connect with each other and organize get together events.

positions.title: Software Development Engineer
positions.description_html:
DMA (Digital Market Action) Users Consent Pipeline
•Led the design and implementation of the orchestrator framework tailored for DMA (Digital Market
Action) users consent analysis which aimed to provide a comprehensive solution for customers to assess
the users' impact of their consent actions in the digital market realm.
•Resolved duplicate computing due to data delay in the old framework. Resulting in accurate and reliable
analysis results with a 40% lower cost.
•Incorporated a mechanism for automatic SLA detection. This feature empowered customers to
effortlessly monitor and adhere to predefined SLAs, enhancing overall operational efficiency.
•All pipeline was built in NAWS (Native AWS), using Cloudformation, AWS Lambda, IAM, S3, AWS Glue,
Cloudwatch, EMR, SQS, etc.

Micro batch Pipeline Transformation with Apache Iceberg
•Led the migration and upgrade of Microbatch pipelines from Hive to Apache Iceberg, enhancing performance for massive analytic tables.
•Facilitated concurrent reads and writes without conflicts, enhancing scalability for data-intensive workloads.
•Ensure data integrity and reliability during high-volume data processing by supporting Transactional Consistency.
•Empower historical data analysis, providing valuable insights for auditing and trend analysis.

Data Certification Framework & Optimization
•Add support for Data Certification to Microbatch Data Pipelines to prevent delayed/missing data. It helps reduce the number of data lookback operations and no manual backfill data.
•Re-design the log aggregation data pipelines aggregating algorithms, helping to minimize the data storage by 50+%.
•Implement migrating our current Microbatch pipelines into a new orchestration framework.
•Support the event-driven trigger type, help to reduce the number of time-based triggers, and send notifications to users when full data is available.

publications.title: Numerical simulation of a practical chemical vapor deposition reactor
publications.subtitle: Journal of Numerical Heat Transfer
publications.description: Numerical simulation was set up to study a rotating vertical impinging chemical vapor deposition (CVD) system for the fabrication of thin films. It has been becoming very costly for manufacturers to produce high potent thin films due to the excessive waste of materials and high energy costs. A numerical study can be used to model and optimize the CVD reactor to yield favorable operating conditions. A simple geometry consisting of a rotating susceptor and flow guide is considered. The study shows visually how the temperature changes as the carrier gases respond to the thermal transport, and the effects of rotation and buoyancy. Commercially available software is used, with modifications, and the results obtained are discussed in detail.

publications.title: Fabrication of Gallium Nitride Films in a Chemical Vapor Deposition Reactor
publications.subtitle: Journal of Thermal Sciences
publications.description: A numerical study has been carried out on the metalorganic chemical vapor deposition (MOCVD) process for the fabrication of gallium nitride (GaN) thin films, which range from a few nanometers to micrometers in thickness. The numerical study is also coupled with an experimental study on the flow and thermal transport processes in the system. Of particular interest in this study is the dependence of the growth rate of GaN and of the uniformity of the film on the flow, resulting from the choice of various design and operating parameters involved in the MOCVD process. Based on an impingement type rotating-disk reactor, three-dimensional simulations have been preformed to indicate the deposition rate increases with reactor pressure, inlet velocity, and wafer rotating speed, while decreases with the precursor concentration ratio. Additionally, a better film uniformity is caused by reducing the reactor pressure, inlet velocity and wafer rotating speed, and increasing precursor concentration ratio. With the impact of wafer temperature included in this study as well, these results are expected to provide a quantitative basis for the prediction, design, and optimization of the process for the fabrication of GaN devices. The flow and the associated transport processes are discussed in detail on the basis of the results obtained to suggest approaches to improve the uniformity of thin film, minimize fluid loss, and reduce flow recirculation that could affect growth rate and uniformity.

recommendations: Ronald Breese “ I've worked with Kevin, throughout multiple organizational restructuring over the years. Kevin needs little direction other than understanding the task that needs to be completed. Kevin accomplishes those tasks understanding all the requirements needed and is a quick study. All new assignments are readily accepted and understood with what is usually less than the average learning curve. Kevin shows resilience with the execution of his job functions which is a direct reflection of his core skills and work ethic. Kevin is an innovative self-starter, who rarely requires supervision. He is punctual, almost always exceeds expectations, manages stress well and voluntarily does whatever is required to meet a deadline to get the job done. Kevin is also a team player and exhibits ‘Teamwork with focus’ at the highest levels. Kevin handles challenges that come and is able to balance projects and multitask accordingly to do the best job possible. He thinks outside the box and ensures that all projects progress to a successful completion. Kevin gives 110% to every task and is an essential part of the team’s success. Kevin is a professional, Senior Software Engineer of the highest caliber, who meticulously researches, writes code, tests code, and certifies product functionality he develops and works with. It is not uncommon for management and employees in technical support, engineering, technical training and other departments to praise his work. ”

Agnes Grenci “I worked with Kevin for several years on an Agile team developing and testing a file transfer product that runs on the z/OS platform at CA Technologies. During that time I was always impressed with his abilities and how quickly he picked up the knowledge he needed to become a valuable addition to the development staff. He brought a fresh face to the team by coming up with suggestions and ideas to make the product more user friendly and always abided by the evaluation of whatever his team mates came up with when they were reviewing his ideas. He was also not afraid to ask questions when he was not sure about anything he was currently developing and always reached out to the more senior team members to get the answers and knowledge he needed to get his work done. He would always volunteer to help anyone when he got his work done during the sprint or when some task came up during our scrum meetings. He was a great worker and was diligent in getting the work that was assigned to him done within the time lines given to our team. I performed Quality Assurance tasks for the same product that Kevin did development work on and he made it very easy for me to approach him whenever I had questions and or found something that might have been a bug with his code. We worked together to go over whatever I ran into and then determined the next action to be done. If I was confused about how a feature worked, he would always take the time to go over what was confusing me and explain the feature in great detail and sometimes even drew a picture so that it was very clear to me how I needed to test that particular feature. This made my job so much easier because of his willingness to work with me as well as all the team members no matter what their role was. He was a great asset to our team because he interfaced so well with everyone and I really enjoyed working with him on this product. I highly recommend Kevin for any development or related position because of his dedication and pride in the work he did when I worked with him. I believe he would be a great addition to any development team because of his experience and knowledge he gained during his time working at CA Technologies.”

experience.title: Bioinformatics Software Engineer III
experience.description: + Work with Pathology Department to create a Data warehouse based off the OMOP Common Data Model+ Created massive scale post-whole slide image processing pipeline to support automated QC and ingestion into computational algorithms for IHC Machine Learning Models. The pipeline processes dozens of Terabytes of pathology imagery daily and uses an event-driven architecture with RabbitMQ+ Created an operational dashboard for Pathology to monitor specimens from collection to delivery to the pathologist using D3.js visualizations and React.js+ Created the team’s DevOps infrastructure for build, deploy, support and test+ Automated Pathology reporting to New York State Cancer Registry and established new workflowsfor operational teams when reporting could not be done automatically+ Created an open-source data entry tool for REDCap and presented a poster at AMIA 2019 AnnualSymposium on the work - https://github.com/mskcc/redcap-linter
experience.description_html:
+ Work with Pathology Department to create a Data warehouse based off the OMOP Common Data Model
+ Created massive scale post-whole slide image processing pipeline to support automated QC and ingestion into computational algorithms for IHC Machine Learning Models. The pipeline processes dozens of Terabytes of pathology imagery daily and uses an event-driven architecture with RabbitMQ
+ Created an operational dashboard for Pathology to monitor specimens from collection to delivery to the pathologist using D3.js visualizations and React.js
+ Created the team’s DevOps infrastructure for build, deploy, support and test
+ Automated Pathology reporting to New York State Cancer Registry and established new workflows
for operational teams when reporting could not be done automatically
+ Created an open-source data entry tool for REDCap and presented a poster at AMIA 2019 Annual
Symposium on the work - https://github.com/mskcc/redcap-linter

experience.title: Lead Software Engineer
experience.description: With Barefoot Coders I primarily consulted with Delectable. Delectable is a fun and social app for wine enthusiasts – snap a photo of a bottle and instantly see ratings and reviews from the Delectable community of renowned sommeliers and wine lovers. Delectable's e-commerce platform is Banquet. Banquet is the second largest wine e-commerce platform in America.+ Moved Delectable infrastructure from Apache Mesos to Kubernetes+ Established strategic partnerships to grow the app and enhance the experience.+ Broad stack of technologies including Node.js, Rails, React.js, Golang, iOS (Swift/Objective-C),Android, relational databases (MySQL and Postgres) and NoSQL datastores (Mongodb, Redis, Elas-ticsearch), Mesos and Docker+ Worked on frontend (React.js, ERB), backend (Node.js, Sinatra, Rails) and mobile (Android, iOS)+ Implemented new freemium subscription model where user’s could sign up for a Patron level toobtain ratings and reviews from Vinous critics

With Barefoot Coders I primarily consulted with Delectable. obtain ratings and reviews from Vinous critics

projects.title: A Study of Credit Scoring Analysis From Data Mining Approaches
projects.description: With the rapid growth in the credit industry, credit scoring models have become essential and been extensively used for the credit admission evaluations to control the risk of default and thus to reduce the loss to the debtor. In this project, we applied traditional statistical models (i.e. LRA, LDA, QDA, Regularized LRA and SVM) on two credit data sets from Australia and Germany from UCI, analyzed and made comparisons of the classification accuracy from each model for each data set. Based on these results, we will then apply advanced methods (i.e. Random Forests, decision tree, SVM with three approaches to find the best parameters) to confirm these cutting edge technologies lead to better accuracy.

projects.title: Economic Forces and the Stock Market
projects.description: An empirical study of the effect different economic indicators had on the US stock market during the decade 2003-2013. The same indicators were also studied in an emerging stock market scenario- in our case, Brazil.

projects.title: Time Series Analysis in Housing Prices (US)
projects.description: The goal of this project is to analyze the house price market in the United States. Specifically, the main focus is on the house price markets in three states: California, New York and New Jersey. In order to make forecasts,different models were tried using ARMA, GARCH and intervention analysis. Also, a time series regression model of house price index was applied with explanatory variables--mortgage interest rate, state population and state unemployment rate.

He was able to clearly communicate the work to the team at large during the demos which were required as part of our SDLC. In closing, I would gladly have Fan on any of my projects as he brings not only the required technical skillset but also the right attitude and work ethic. I know he will find continued success as a system architect or a senior software engineer. Regards, Peter Babigian”

name: Joshua Yu, MBA
city: New Brunswick, New Jersey, United States
about:
My passion lies in the exploration of areas and opportunities to disrupt traditional business models and strategies with emerging technological innovation.

I have 3 years of experience as a Lead Software Engineer at CyberMed Health. Under my leadership, I conceptualized, designed, and launched an innovative communication application that is utilized by more than 27,000 unique active patients and over 500 doctors. I explore, analyze, and interpret big data regarding the company’s telehealth and remote patient monitoring, delivering detailed quarterly reports for utilization by clients. In addition, I liaise with senior leadership, outside organizations, and departmental teams to ensure the company’s product engineering structure is driving the business forward with minimal expenditures.

I am interested in contacting former colleagues and managers, as well as other professionals in my field. Feel free to contact me through this profile if you wish to connect.

projects.title: Book Recommender Based on MongoDB
projects.description: This is a project to provide book recommendation using Amazon dataset.- Extracted and purified users, ratings and items data from Amazon dataset and stored them in MongoDB database.- Designed a user-based Collaborative Filtering algorithm based on similarity scores between users.- Calculated similarity scores with MapReduce in MongoDB and recommended current user the movies that similar users have watched.- Tested the performance among 22M items.

projects.title: Customer Churn Prediction and Analysis - Supervised Learning
projects.description: - Developed algorithms for telecommunications service to predict customer churn probability based on labeled data using Python and Spark.- Preprocessed data set by data cleaning, categorical feature transformation, standardization and feature correlation.- Trained supervised machine learning models including Logistic Regression, Random Forest and K-Nearest Neighbors, and applied regularization with optimal parameters to overcome overfitting.- Evaluated model performance of classification via K-fold cross-validation and confusion matrix- Analyzed feature importance to identify top factors that influenced the results.

projects.title: GoRestaurants - Java Web Service for Restaurant Recommendation
projects.description: A dynamic web page to provide nearby restaurants and improve the recommendation based on visited history.Website: http://gorestaurants.mooo.com/Dashi/- Created Java Servlets with RESTful APIs to handle HTTP requests and responses.- Built MySQL database to capture restaurant data from Yelp API and store user preferences.- Designed a Content-based recommendation algorithm for restaurant recommendation.- Implemented user registration and login session and tested the web service locally with JUnit.- Designed an interactive web page utilizing AJAX technology (HTML, CSS and JavaScript).- Deployed the server on Amazon EC2, which can handle 150 queries per second tested by Apache JMeter.

projects.title: Massive Documents Analysis - Topic Modeling
projects.description: Unsupervised learning to cluster unlabeled textual documents from Reuters dataset into groups with different topics.- Preprocessed the data by removing common meaningless words and extracted the value of term frequency-inverse document frequency (TF-IDF) to take documents represented as bag-of-words counts.- Implemented unsupervised learning model Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA) to cluster the massive documents into groups.- Tested with different initial number of topics on the 21K documents and 41K valid words from Reuters.- Evaluated the performance by human judgement, perplexity and KL-divergence.

projects.title: Driiible - Dribbble Client Android App
projects.description: Driiible is an Android application for users to login and view popular shots of the online design community Dribbble.- Designed basic UI using RecyclerView, CardView and Navigation Drawer.- Implemented user login based on OAuth to get authentication using Dribbble API.- Displayed the real data from Dribbble website by making network requests using OkHttp.- Achieved functions of Like, Share, animated GIF image loading, pull-to-refresh and bucket storing to improve user experience.

publications.title: Effectiveness of Teager Energy Operator for Epoch Detection from Speech Signals
publications.subtitle: International Journal of Speech Technology, Springer, Verlag
publications.description: - Second highest downloaded article in the journal and has been handpicked by the editor in chief as one of the most intriguing articles for the period Sep 2011 to Jul 2012- In this paper, we try to present the problem of epoch detection from a different perspective that not only deals with estimation of epoch instances, but also with quantification of the absence of epochs in the unvoiced regions of speech signal. Most of the epoch detection methods perform significantly well in the voiced regions of speech but are not robust enough in the unvoiced regions of speech. We propose a simple method based on Teager Energy Operator (TEO) which not only determines the epochs in voiced region but also is very effective in unvoiced region. Due to the noise suppression capability of TEO, the proposed method has almost no or little effect against signal degradations like white, babble, high frequency and vehicle noises as compared to 0-Hz resonator and DYPSA methods.

publications.title: Energy Separation Algorithm Based Spectrum Estimation for Formant Estimation from Very Short Durations of Speech
publications.subtitle: Speech Communication (Elsevier)
publications.description: -A novel algorithm based on Energy Separation Algorithm (ESA) and digital resonators is developed in this paper that estimates formants from just 1 ms of voiced speech signals. This formant estimation spectrum gives much sharper -3dB bandwidths in the case of female speech and nasal formants as opposed to state-of-the-art LP spectrum.

recommendations: Mukunda Nemade “I worked with Vardhany for more than six years. During those years I witnessed Vardhany’s dedication to work, excellence in resolving issues and her ability to work with multiple disciplines: management, development, requirement, installation and deployment teams. She was respected by all the team members and was always appreciated for her contribution to the product quality and customer experience. Vardhany has shown great clarity and focus and contributed to CI/CD, automation of regression testing and the process improvement. She has also demonstrated the ability to lead teams and carry out various roles as required by product teams with excellence. She was promoted to the manager position over the course of these years. I strongly believe that she will expand the horizon of any team she joins. ”

LinkedIn User “When Vardhany first joined our project, she was the key lead on our test team. Vardhnay applied a strong customer focus to ensure product quality. This often meant that she had to challenge senior staff members when issues were discovered to ensure that they were fully dealt with before product releases were made available. She never shrunk from this and successfully negotiated reasonable resolutions that met the interests of customers and the product. When she was made a development team manager, she was handed the assignment to manage some newly-formed teams to address some urgent "platform" issues, in such areas as upgrade, security, and CI/CD flows. There were several challenges that she had to deal with, including the loose definition/prioritization of the work items and ensuring that the new teams (who were largely Java application developers) gained the additional competencies that they would need to perform those tasks. Vardhany worked diligently to define the tasks that she thought were most important, presenting to both upper management and the teams to gain consensus and understanding. She initiated training for the team members and monitored the work closely to adjust tasks as necessary and deal with unexpected issues. As a result, the teams expanded their skills and, with Vardhany's leadership, were able to begin addressing the complex issues that we needed to solve. Vardhany is able to apply sound judgement to a variety of problems and is able to break down complex goals into manageable tasks. She is a relentless and passionate customer advocate and drives teams' to the best solutions. She is a great team player and is able to quickly pivot when task priorities change. We have been lucky to have Vardhany on our team, and her skills can easily be applied in many areas. ”

projects.title: Tic Tac Toe
projects.description: In order to play around with an algorithm that was taught in my undergraduate Artificial Intelligence class, I decided to put together this game of tic tac toe. The algorithm used is the Minimax algorithm and it is written in C while the webapp is served by the Flask framework. Give it a try and see if you have what it takes to defeat the machine! The source can be found on Github!

projects.title: Where RU Professor
projects.description: A simple web app that lets a user search for all the classes that a Rutgers New Brunswick professor teaches based on the professor's last name. As of right now the 'all' search queries the entire Rutgers Schedule of Classes via GET requests hence the search will take a few minutes. Specifying a department speeds up the query, but in the future I plan to just copy the entire schedule of classes into a local database which would then drastically speed up the search. The source can be found on Github!

projects.title: Letters Game
projects.description: A basic game written purely in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (and jQuery). The rules of the game are simple, don't let any letter hit the right side of the box or you lose. You gain one point for a correct letter hit and you lose one point for an incorrect letter hit. This fun little game definitely helped me strengthen my JavaScript and exposed me to the various considerations that have to go into when developing a game for the web. The source can be found on Github!

projects.title: Random Filler
projects.description: This basic Chrome Extension aids in testing of web registration forms. While developing a registration form for the GSAPP 50th Anniversary Gala, I ended up filling out the form that I was coding many times. After trying many varying form filling Chrome Extensions, I have decided that they were either too complicated or did not have the features that I wanted thus I became motivated to bring Random Filler to life. All I really wanted from a form filler is the option to just throw truly random nonsense data in the fields or be able to use a few realistic looking edge test cases. The extension is available for download in the Chrome Store. The source to the extension can be found on my Github.

projects.title: Wiki Translate
projects.description: A simple Flask/MongoDB web app that utilizes Wikipedia API (along with Wikipedia python library) to fetch Wikipedia translations for words/phrases. A dictionary translation is given on the side for comparison by Yandex.Translate. For instance, have you ever wondered how the movie "Limitless" is called in Polish or any other language? If you have, the only way to find out would be to search Wikipedia for the English version and look on the side for other language translations. Wikipedia Translate does exactly this with a click of a button! The source can be found on my Github!

projects.title: The Terminal Site
projects.description: When I initially started creating my personal site I had a hard time coming up with a decent design, thus during that stage I came up with an idea to just make my site into a Ubuntu terminal. I actually ended up finishing my personal site first and then got to creating a terminal version. What I mean by terminal version is that you can browse the content of the site in the same manner in which you navigate a terminal.

experience.title: Software Engineer Intern
experience.description: As a Software Engineer Intern at Zendesk, I contributed to modernizing the React-based user interface by migrating from Fela to Styled-Components, improving scalability and developer efficiency. I transitioned JavaScript codebases to TypeScript, enhancing code reliability and maintainability. Additionally, I rewrote and optimized system tests, including unit, integration, and load tests, using tools like Cypress, React Testing Library, and Storybook to ensure application robustness. This experience provided hands-on exposure to large-scale monolithic architectures, debugging complex applications, and collaborating with cross-functional teams. I gained expertise in scalable front-end development and testing, while learning how top-tier engineering teams operate efficiently.► Spearheaded the migration of Zendesk's React-based user interface from Fela to Styled-Components, enhancing maintainability, scalability, and developer productivity through reusable and intuitive styling solutions.► Transitioned JavaScript files to TypeScript, improving code quality and reducing runtime errors, ensuring a more robust and maintainable application.► Rewrote and optimized system tests, including unit, integration, and load tests, leveraging tools such as React Testing Library, Mocha, Jest, Enzyme, Cypress, and Storybook to enhance test coverage and application reliability.► Contributed to the modernization of a large-scale monolithic codebase, improving debugging efficiency and performance while collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver high-impact solutions in a fast-paced engineering environment.
experience.description_html:
As a Software Engineer Intern at Zendesk, I contributed to modernizing the React-based user interface by migrating from Fela to Styled-Components, improving scalability and developer efficiency. I transitioned JavaScript codebases to TypeScript, enhancing code reliability and maintainability. Additionally, I rewrote and optimized system tests, including unit, integration, and load tests, using tools like Cypress, React Testing Library, and Storybook to ensure application robustness. This experience provided hands-on exposure to large-scale monolithic architectures, debugging complex applications, and collaborating with cross-functional teams. I gained expertise in scalable front-end development and testing, while learning how top-tier engineering teams operate efficiently.
► Spearheaded the migration of Zendesk's React-based user interface from Fela to Styled-Components, enhancing maintainability, scalability, and developer productivity through reusable and intuitive styling solutions.
► Transitioned JavaScript files to TypeScript, improving code quality and reducing runtime errors, ensuring a more robust and maintainable application.
► Rewrote and optimized system tests, including unit, integration, and load tests, leveraging tools such as React Testing Library, Mocha, Jest, Enzyme, Cypress, and Storybook to enhance test coverage and application reliability.
► Contributed to the modernization of a large-scale monolithic codebase, improving debugging efficiency and performance while collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver high-impact solutions in a fast-paced engineering environment.

experience.title: Data Intern
experience.description: As a Data Engineering Intern at Disney ESPN, contributed to the data validation aspect of a large-scale migration project from OracleDB to SnowflakeDB. Designed and validated SQL queries to ensure data accuracy, completeness, and reliability during the transition. Developed a Python-based validation script to streamline workflows and enhance data quality, collaborating with cross-functional teams to address quality issues effectively. Gained hands-on experience in cloud-based data architectures, ETL pipelines, and debugging, improving operational efficiency and data reliability.► Optimized Data Migration- Developed and validated 250+ SQL scripts for the Consumption and Conformance layers, ensuring seamless migration from Oracle to AWS and Snowflake while improving data processing efficiency.► Enhanced Data Validation Frameworks- Upgraded Python-based validation scripts by adding new features, resulting in improved accuracy, completeness, and reliability of data workflows.► Streamlined Issue Management- Identified and resolved critical data quality issues using JIRA to track and manage tasks, ensuring smooth project execution and adherence to data integrity standards.
experience.description_html:
As a Data Engineering Intern at Disney ESPN, contributed to the data validation aspect of a large-scale migration project from OracleDB to SnowflakeDB. Designed and validated SQL queries to ensure data accuracy, completeness, and reliability during the transition. Developed a Python-based validation script to streamline workflows and enhance data quality, collaborating with cross-functional teams to address quality issues effectively. Gained hands-on experience in cloud-based data architectures, ETL pipelines, and debugging, improving operational efficiency and data reliability.
► Optimized Data Migration- Developed and validated 250+ SQL scripts for the Consumption and Conformance layers, ensuring seamless migration from Oracle to AWS and Snowflake while improving data processing efficiency.
► Enhanced Data Validation Frameworks- Upgraded Python-based validation scripts by adding new features, resulting in improved accuracy, completeness, and reliability of data workflows.
► Streamlined Issue Management- Identified and resolved critical data quality issues using JIRA to track and manage tasks, ensuring smooth project execution and adherence to data integrity standards.

name: Howard A. A. Smith
about:
I have a passion for data science and machine learning.


Programming: Python (pandas, numpy, Scipy, matplotlib , scikit-learn, pytorch, seaborn) , SQL.
Statistics: Probability, Distribution, Hypothesis Testing, Bayes Theorem, ANOVA, A/B test, Nonparametric, Time Series.
Machine Learning: generalized linear models, decision trees, random forest, gradient boosting, k-nearest neighbors, k- means clustering, naive bayes, Convolutional Neural Networks, LSTM.

• Deployed web application using Flask and Heroku.

publications.title: Decision Trees and Categorical Independent Variables with Many Levels
publications.subtitle: Casualty Actuarial Society E-Forum
publications.description: This paper discusses a common concern regarding decision tree models, which is categorical independent variables with many levels. We argue that categorical variables with many levels do not always cause trouble, and any preprocessing on them should consider sample size, correlation among response and independent variables, and many other factors.

publications.title: Measuring Changes in Inflation: A Non-Technical Discussion of Two Techniques
publications.subtitle: Casualty Actuarial Society - Casualty Loss Reserve Seminar
publications.description: We presented two approaches to modeling inflation and its variability. One approach uses a smoothing spline to smooth a severity index. The other approach measures the variability in a triangle associated with cyclical changes in the severity trend using Fourier series.
